description: At Optiv, we’re on a mission to help our clients make their businesses more secure. We’re one of the fastest growing companies in a truly essential industry.In your role at Optiv, you’ll be inspired by a team of the brightest business and technical minds in cybersecurity. We are passionate champions for our clients, and know from experience that the best solutions for our clients’ needs come from working hard together. As part of our team, your voice matters, and you will do important work that has impact, on people, businesses and nations. Our industry and our company move fast, and you can be sure that you will always have room to learn and grow. We’re proud of our team and the important work we do to build confidence for a more connected world.Who we are looking for:Our consultants are skilled technical and consultative resources expected to be strong in both technical and soft skills. A Consultant must be a proven self-starter with the ability to problem-solve, communicate, participate in diverse project teams from a technical perspective, and interface effectively with customers, vendor partners, and colleagues. Establish & maintain productive and respectful relationships with the delivery team, practice management, and client management team.How will you make an impact:You will actively contribute to improving operational efficiency on projects and internal initiatives. Deliver timely engagements and work closely with Practice Directors to drive training and education, career development, performance development, and collaboration across the team. In line with Optiv’s commitment to quality, you will confirm that work is of the highest quality as per Optiv’s quality standards, by reviewing the work provided by other members.Able to solo deliver or act as "point" for complex technology implementation projectsActs as a technical escalation point to assist other consultants.Lead in capacity planning and HW specification recommendation efforts.Lead in all Technology deployment activities, connector configuration, custom rule development, workflow configuration and development, and third-party system integration.Understand the customer requirements and deliverables and create a comprehensive Statement of Work (SOW)Netskope cloud security assessmentsUnderstand System integration with SSO, AD, Proxies, Cloud API’s, VM’s & as a contributor in Optiv communities for solutions of focusQualifications for success:Ideal candidates will have recent prior experience implementing or managing a Netskope environmentBachelor's degree and approximately 5-7 years of related work experience.Approximately 4-7 years of technical architecture experience5+ years of experience as a Professional Services Consultant with a proven track record and demonstrable skills at presenting technical information at the business executive level or at the architect levelExcellent knowledge and prior experience with network security technologies including but not limited to: Proxies, NG Firewalls, SSL/IPSec, VPN’s, SSO, DLP and Encryption gatewaysDemonstrable experience with systems installation, configuration and administration UNIX/Linux and Windows-based systems (prior Active Directory/LDAP experience desirable)MDM, Cloud APIs, Strong Networking conceptsDesirable experience within one or more of the following Security Architecture and/or Enterprise Architectural Frameworks (e.g. SABSA, TOGAF, O-ESA).Scripting Language (Perl/Python)Knowledge of general security concepts and methods such as vulnerability assessments, Cross Border, and U.S. State Data Privacy Laws.Working knowledge of operating systems, virtual machine environments, mainframe security packages, and relational database management systems.Ability to build relationships with and influence other functional areasWell-developed negotiation skills.Ability to build consensus.Ability to manage multiple tasks in parallelWillingness to travel to meet client needs;Valid driver's license in the USThe successful candidate must hold related professional certifications such as the CISSP, CISM, and/or CISA.#LI-PS1If you are seeking a culture that supports growth, fosters success and moves the industry forward, find your place at Optiv! As a market-leading provider of cyber security solutions, Optiv has the most comprehensive ecosystem of security products and partners to deliver unparalleled services. Our rich and successful history with our clients is based on trust, serving more than 12,000 clients of varying sizes and industries, including commercial, government and education. We have the proven expertise to plan, build, and run successful security programs across Risk Management, Cyber Digital Transformation, Threat Management, Security Operations - Managed Services and Identity and Data Management.With Optiv you can expect:A company committed to championing Diversity, Equality and Inclusion through Affinity groups including but not limited to, Women's Network, Optiv Pride, Black Employee Network, and Veterans Support Network.Work/life balance. We offer “Recharge” a flexible, time-off program that encourages eligible employees to take the time they need to rechargeProfessional training resources, including tuition reimbursementCreative problem-solving and the ability to tackle unique, complex projectsVolunteer Opportunities. “Optiv Chips In” encourages employees to volunteer and engage with their teams and communities.The ability and technology necessary to productively work remote/from home (where applicable)Optiv is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, status as an individual with a disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

About GMThere’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.Why Work for UsOur culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.Job DescriptionIn recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM’s global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed and business value.As a Business Analyst (BA), within the Global Sales, Service, Marketing and Customer Experience IT Organization, you will work side-by-side with business process owners and key stakeholders to identify opportunities and elicit business requirements. You will analyze and evaluate solutions options, facilitate requirements gathering sessions, deliver business value through execution of medium to large projects and develop future strategy To be successful, you must be customer focused, be able to clearly define and communicate business needs, and be personally driven to improve the business.Major duties / responsibilities:Project coordination & execution role for Plan and Define as part of the System Development processDevelopment of business process models, business requirements/user stories (functional and non-functional) and product backlogsPartners with business to ensure comprehensive user acceptance testing/training plans are developed/executed and application is successfully transitioned to productionIncreased understanding of business issues and data challenges of the businessServes as the requirement's liaison between the business community and the IT teamsCoordinates with Business on Problem and Incident ManagementCoordinates project business value/return on investment analysisSupports IT Strategy DevelopmentIdentifies business strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvementMakes recommendations on what projects should be pursuedPerform research on new insights / initiatives the organization may want to pursueAssists with coordination & representation for Change Requests (CRs)Performs other related duties as assigned.Knowledge:In-depth understanding of business analyst fundamentalsIn-depth understanding of writing & leading Business Requirements DocumentsIn-depth understanding of Business Process ModelingKnowledge in a functional area or business process domainIn-depth understanding of business issues and data challenges of the organization and industry as a wholeIn-depth understanding of business process and how application(s) they represent support itDemonstrates critical skills such as collaboration, strong written and verbal communication skills and analytical capabilityIndependently facilitates sessions with end users, asking probing questions to elicit business process discussion and capture process flow diagramsIndependently facilitates meetings.Critical skills:In-depth business knowledgeAction orientedRaises issues appropriatelyPresents information for decision-making purposes with little to no directionIncreased technical & business insight for planningStrong time ,management skillsAbility to multi-task i.e. leading multiple projectsAdditional Job DescriptionRequirements:Bachelor's degree required (technical subject area preferred) or equivalent experience. 7+ years in an applicable business environment.Proven in-depth understanding of Business Process fundamentals; including requirements elicitation, stakeholder collaboration, effective and timely communications, and problem-solving skillsExperience in IT project management, requirements definition, process definition, testing, and IT strategy and roadmap development.Expertise in utilizing requirements toolsExperience with Dealer/Customer Business ProcessesExperience in troubleshooting and resolving issuesExperience with Agile development methodologiesGood Communication (verbal and written) and analytical skillsPreferred Qualifications:Master's Degree in Business, IT, Engineering, or relatedDevelopment experiencePMP CertifiedCertified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certificationBenefits OverviewThe goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.Diversity InformationGeneral Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.Equal Employment Opportunity StatementsThe policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com . In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

INTRODUCTION The Zebra, named a Best Place to Work in Austin four years running, is revolutionizing how connected consumers research and shop for insurance. We're a purpose-driven company looking for a Technical Business Analyst to drive smarter decisions for our Finance team and key stakeholders. Reporting directly to a Sr. Manager, Analytics, you will have clear visibility into company direction and strategy. In this pivotal position, you'll build out robust dashboards, reports, and processes to predict and highlight changes in revenue, cost and return-on-investment to optimize performance across the organization.
Please note - all new hires must be able to relocate to Austin, Texas by the time of their start date.

This position is not currently eligible for visa sponsorship

WHAT YOU'LL DO:



Build and maintain reports, dashboards and visualizations that communicate impact, business insights and recommendations to the Finance team.
Analyze financial trends to optimize for better performance and recommend actions to improve monetization, maximize return on investment, diversify risk, and act proactively on opportunities.
Develop, manage and maintain weekly financial pacing reports and ad hoc requests with an emphasis on data visualization
Gather requirements from stakeholders and take a proactive, self-starter approach to digging into the data to find opportunities for the Finance team to act on that align with operational goals.
Partner with Data Engineers to maintain a data framework that provides consistent financial data with the necessary documentation and access to historical data.
Become a subject matter expert in Finance metrics and related data.
Serve as the "glue" between the Data and Finance teams to communicate data updates, interpret findings, explain data variability, and provide data solutions.

REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS:



2+ years of analytics experience
Experience with SQL and relational databases
Experience with BI platforms such as Looker and Tableau
Reporting and dashboard creation (e.g. forecasting, pacing, etc.)
Strong attention to detail

ABOUT THE ZEBRAThe Zebra is the nation's leading insurance search comparison site. With its dynamic, real-time quote comparison tool, drivers can identify insurance companies with the coverage, service level, and pricing to suit their unique needs. The Zebra compares more than 100 car insurance companies and provides licensed agent support and educational resources to ensure drivers are equipped to make the most informed decisions about their policies. It's "insurance in black and white."

Headquartered in Austin, Texas, The Zebra has garnered the attention and investment of some of the nation's top venture capitalists, and the company's success has been profiled in publications like Inc., Time, Forbes, and TechCrunch. Austin Business Journal named The Zebra a Best Place to Work in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2020. Austin American-Statesman awarded The Zebra as a Top Workplace in 2016, 2017 and 2018. Inc. Magazine also awarded The Zebra as Best Workplaces - 2018, 2019, 2020.

The Zebra is aiming to grow our fantastic team to add to our dynamic culture and continue building on our success. Working at The Zebra means never being bored, always being challenged, and supporting one another. We're a happy, hardworking group, and we're eager to add "new stripes" who share those values.

The Zebra is an equal opportunity employer and "at will" company.

As part of our dedication to maintaining an inclusive and diverse workforce, The Zebra provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

The Zebra expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Do you find yourself staring at a complex world and identifying problems to engineer away? Are you passionate about creating great user experiences within a product? Can you take vague user problems and turn them into real plans?

Levelset is hiring a Business Analyst who will be instrumental in detailing the design, development, and product features of our core product.

The Business Analyst at Levelset works with product managers and software engineers to write user stories, refine requirements with technical leads, meet with business stakeholders, and analyze data to make informed product development decisions.

You will work with the project management teams to determine the detail and scope of features, recommend solutions and functionality, and work with quality assurance teams to write and perform acceptance testing.

If you have the right stuff to join us, you'll work among passionate professionals who are disrupting a $1 Trillion industry, in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, and professionally challenging environment. The role demands great technical depth, well-honed product judgment, a strong will to fight for your product vision, sincere and impressive empathy for users who may be nothing like you, and a stubborn ability to look at how everyone else is approaching a problem and not conforming.

This role can be based in either New Orleans, LA or Austin, TX

Responsibilities

Work with a cross-functional team to define features, write user specifications and user stories, assist in creating wireframes, prototypes, test plans, release checklists. Develop a deep understanding of Levelsets core product and the problems it solves to drive product strategy and decisions.Work with your team to estimate, implement, and build features while ensuring that youre working on the highest priority tasksCollaborate with sales, customer success, support, marketing, and other cross-functional teams to deeply understand our core customers motivations and pain points, and build the best possible product solutions for our core customers.Represent your team in communication with product, engineering, and marketing leadership.Ensure we ship well-crafted product at a fast pace.

Requirements

Product management or Business analyst experience on a SaaS product (B2B preferred)Bachelor's degree (Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related discipline preferred.)Proven history of working on, shipping and helping manage products with cross-functional teams. Experience providing customer behavior insights in a data-driven environment.Experience using software to extract, analyze, organize and communicate data to support and drive decision making.Previous experience shipping features and iterating on successful products.Outstanding communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills.Strong user experience design sensibilities and a passion for making the lives of our users easier.Technical abilities (HTML/CSS/PHP/SQL/APIs) are a plus.Ability to work independently, communicating across multiple time zonesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work with business stakeholders and influence outcomesExcellent knowledge of Excel and similar softwareOrganized and detail oriented, being able to produce highly accurate reports and requirementsExcellent system analysis and process modeling skillsExcellent cost-benefit analysis skillsHigh analytical and problem solving skillsCapable of understanding business structure and value propositionsWorking understanding of Relational and Graph databases

About Levelset

Levelset has been named one of the "Best Places to Work" by New Orleans CityBusiness three years in a row for our mission-driven culture and commitment to internal and external growth. Backed by venture funding, we are growing rapidly and looking for new exciting team members to add their unique talents to our mission. We empower contractors to always get what they earn, and our software platform makes lien rights, payment paperwork, and compliance in the construction industry simple and stress-free, so contractors and suppliers can get paid faster, have easier access to capital, and less surprises.

Levelset is venture-backed by Horizons Ventures, S3 Ventures, Altos Ventures, and Brick & Mortar Ventures. Levelset is headquartered in New Orleans, Louisiana, with offices in Austin, Texas, and Cairo, Egypt, and is about 200 employees strong.

Why Levelset

Were a rapidly growing team working on interesting and worthwhile problemsWith a newly distributed workforce, we make engagement and employee wellness even more of a priority. We want you to love your job! We believe professional growth (i.e. building your skills) is essential. Working here provides the opportunity for increased responsibility, continuous learning, and more.We have a very welcoming culture that starts at the top with our CEO.Nothing is a secret here, we think honesty and transparency create a productive workplace.Recognition for hard work and demonstrating our core values is important to us.

Benefits

Competitive health benefits, including mental, emotional, and behavioral health benefits and an easy to use Employee Assistance Program.Flexible sick & personal leave policy needed for health, family, and parenting during this tough time.Open vacation policy without a cap on the number of days-off. We do require employees to take a minimum of 5 days off in a row each year. Subsidized International Travel: We subsidize international travel starting at 6 months, and increasing each yearEquity, per companys general stock grant plan 401k account through Betterment which allows you to seamlessly save money for retirement directly from your paycheckLearning and Development Opportunities: In the spirit of our core value to Learn Enough, we offer a book reimbursement program. If you share what you learned from a book with the team, we'll reimburse you for it. We also provide ample room for learning and development opportunities through Coursera online courses, outside speakers, and opportunities to learn skills from your colleagues.

Levelset is committed to providing an environment where any and all people feel welcome, respected, and free to be their authentic selves. We welcome applicants of all gender identities, sexual orientation, educational background, religion, ethnicities, veteran status, and citizenships.

Advance your career at Texas Windstorm Insurance/Texas Fair Plan Association (TWIA/TFPA) as a Business Analyst (BA) in our Operations Department. We are looking for a BA that is intellectually curious, self-motivated a critical thinker and is technically proficient. This is a key role for our department that will work with IT and other departments to implement efficient, cost-effective document management, high volume print production and mail technology solutions to support our business operations.

TWIA/TFPA is one of the few companies in Austin, Texas with a high-volume print production environment utilizing PlanetPress document management software and mail inserting using Pitney Bowes production hardware. Experience in Agile development methodologies (SCRUM) in Guidewire projects,

functional experience in all processes related to Policy Center, Claims Center, Billing Center, Digital portals of Guidewire product suite is needed. Our ideal candidate is a strong communicator who understands how the software application and hardware work and can provide recommendations on how to best use them to meet our business needs.

POSITION SUMMARY: This position is responsible for duties related to the review, assessment and development of business processes defining the operations and information requirements to support internal policy administration systems and exterior document management software. The Business Analyst position will serve as a liaison between Operations, IT, other department stakeholders with the goal of implementing efficient, cost-effective technology solutions by determining and communicating project and program requirements. This includes an understanding of technical structures, policy print flows and department workflow dynamics that service the needs of the entire enterprise.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: THE FOLLOWING ARE THE USUAL, BASIC AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION. HOWEVER, THIS JOB DESCRIPTION DOES NOT PRECLUDE THE PERFORMANCE OF OTHER DUTIES BY THE INCUMBENT. THESE FUNCTIONS ARE NOT TO BE CONSTRUED AS AN EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF ALL RESPONSIBILITIES, DUTIES, AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

• Serve as primary interface between Operations Department, IT and other departments in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems.

• Act as a liaison between Operations department, project managers, business units, technical developers, and Plan Press software vendor Pitney Bowes. Document and communicate technical functions and specifications for Pitney Bowes document management software.

• Define the scope of IT development or enhancement projects including defining, documenting and developing detailed business requirement documents, developing policies and procedures, creating testing and implementation plans, and promoting the needs and interests of the department.

• Combine business planning expertise to analyze and translate business requirements into system deployments and/or business process changes.

• Communicate to management, stakeholders and development staff to inform, educate and initiate action or change when required.

• Evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, disseminate high-level concepts into details, distinguish actual needs, identify root cause of problems and create logical and innovative solutions.

• Research and resolve business problems by identifying root causes, gathering input from key stakeholders, and researching and recommending appropriate solution options. Provide regular status reports and problem resolution summaries.

• Identify opportunities for improving business processes through information system and non-system driven changes.

• Collect, analyze and report performance data to identify, prioritize, and deliver improvements to the department. Develop and analyze metrics and prepare analytical reports.

• Manage projects and provide project support by tracking project schedules, tasks and activities; follow up with staff regarding project deadlines; develop and publish project documentation; schedule project meetings, and communicate frequently about projects and schedules.

• Assist in assessing training needs. Develop and implement effective training programs, utilizing all appropriate delivery methods, including classroom training, on-the-job training, webinars, teleconferences, eLearning, reference materials and job aids.

• Assist in developing Underwriting, Operations, and Accounting processes and procedures and defining deliverables for system development, system operation, change management, and training.

REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience or equivalent experience

PREFERRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

• Ability to work within a team contributing input, defining dependencies from other team members’ task, seeking prioritization and schedule requirements

• Ability to exercise independent judgment in methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results

• Ability to complete assigned tasks with ample time to test results and react to bugs

REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:

• Communication: Makes clear and convincing oral presentations and written documents (to individuals and groups) that achieve their purpose.

• Customer Focus: Identifies customer’s needs and requirements correctly and provides value added solutions; acts proactively for ensuring customer satisfaction.

• Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrate personal respect for others and conveys an understanding of others’ needs, feelings and perspectives.

• Decision Making: Uses effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions. Makes timely and sound decisions by comparing data from different sources to draw conclusions. Understands the impact and implications of decisions and provides feedback on outcomes. Takes responsibility for decisions.

• Critical Thinking: Approaches a situation or problem by defining the problem or issue, determining its significance, collecting data, making inferences about the meaning of the data, and using logic and intuition to arrive at conclusions or decisions.

• Job Knowledge: Possesses the level of technical and functional knowledge necessary to meet individual performance targets and perform the required duties as outlined in the position description.

• Initiative: Independently completes tasks and assignments with little or minimal direction.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.What you’ll be doing…The Customer Success Principle Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the analytics needs for programs to drive customer retention in our Customer Success and Renewals business. Business Systems Analyst

Seattle, WA & San Francisco, CA (REMOTE, until otherwise noted)

About the Role. . .

Our Digital Transformation team is looking for seasoned Business Systems Analysts to work with cutting-edge technologies and interesting companies in a fast-paced, exciting environment. These Business Systems Analysts will participate in projects supporting one or more work streams and multiple business teams. You will need to have effective communication and a wide variety of skills to support or lead activities, including gathering, analyzing, and documenting stakeholder requirements (developing Process Maps/ Wire Frames/ Feature Acceptance Criteria/ User Stories), and collaborating closely with technical teams to ensure delivered solutions meet business needs.

At the same time, you’ll be joining a five-time “Best Company to Work For,” where intelligent, talented people come together to do outstanding work—and have a lot of fun while they’re at it. Because we’re a full-service consulting firm with a diverse client base, you can count on a steady stream of opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies on projects that make a real difference. Logic20/20's Global Delivery Model creates a connected experience for Logicians across geographies. You'll have access to projects in different locations, the technology to support Connected Teams, and in-person and online culture in our Connected Hub cities.

The Logic20/20 Digital Transformation team is where innovation comes to life. We apply design thinking and next-gen technologies to solve our clients’ toughest business challenges in ways they never dreamed possible. You’ll work side-by-side with various architecture, manager, and engineering consultants to gain a 360-degree perspective of the challenge at hand, while contributing your unique perspective to develop innovative solutions. And when you want to expand your horizons, we’ve got you covered. You’ll have opportunities to shape the next chapter of your career by getting hands-on experience with emerging technologies like RPA, virtual assistants, and more.

You Have. . .

Relevant work experience in evaluating business systems, project execution, or technology – empowering business through robust technology improvements. Experience managing ambiguity and complexity in unstructured operating environments, while able to navigate in larger, more structured environments. Experience with and ability to quickly develop and in-depth understanding of business rules and processes to the extent of being able to optimize/streamline the workflows. Ability to clearly communicate sophisticated concepts to the clients and project team. Experience in one or more SDLC methodology (i.e. Waterfall, Agile, Scrum), and ability to work within the process. Proficiency with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and experience with Visio

Qualifications. . .

Have worked for a Big 4/8 management consulting firmAn undergraduate degree (BA/BS) in business or technology SDLC methodologies3-5+ years in BSA type roles (not exclusively or predominantly testing) A high degree of creativity and innovation, with proven examples of applying knowledge, experience, and judgment to ambiguous problems. Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills; must be very comfortable with data Strong consensus-building skills between business and technology partners Detail-oriented and believe that details matter greatly to the success of the solution Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills The aptitude to see and think through complex end-to-end enterprise processes and system flows

About Logic20/20. . .

Logic20/20 is one of Seattle’s fastest-growing consulting firms. We hire remarkable people to create simple, efficient solutions for complex problems.

Although we make it look like magic, our success is due to our approach (methodical and structured) and the people we hire (smart, motivated, and team oriented). Together, these enable us to consistently exceed client expectations—and our reputation is growing.

For the past five years, we’ve placed in the top ten of Seattle Business magazine’s “Best Companies to Work For”. From engaged leadership and wide-ranging benefits to career mentorship and diverse internal opportunities, we pride ourselves on being one of the best companies to work with and work for.

We hire people that are self-motivated, comfortable conceiving strategies on the fly, and enjoy working individually and as part of a team. Our work is high-energy and demanding, but new hires will quickly feel at home among colleagues as friendly and focused as they are. We bring our best to every opportunity, driving change in industries across the West Coast. Join us and you can, too.

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
About Pulse8, Inc.

Pulse8 is an innovative Healthcare Analytics and Technology Company that delivers visibility and transparency for Risk Adjustment and Quality Management programs. We enable health plans and at-risk providers to achieve the greatest financial impact in the Health Insurance Exchange (HIX), Medicare Advantage, and Medicaid markets. By combining advanced analytic methodologies with extensive health plan experience, Pulse8 has developed a suite of uniquely pragmatic solutions that are revolutionizing risk adjustment. Pulse8's flexible business intelligence tools offer real-time visibility into member and provider activities so our clients can apply the most cost-effective and appropriate interventions for closing gaps in documentation, coding, and quality.

What's cool about working for Pulse8? 
We're a close knit team of Healthcare and Technology experts dedicated to helping people live longer, healthier lives. You'll get to help us design and build innovative solutions from the ground up and have the opportunity to do lots of interesting things in an entrepreneurial culture. We offer competitive benefits and much, much more!

Position Description

The Operations Business Analyst is accountable for maintaining process/technology documentation, quality program documentation and testing, and production monitoring/execution of the areas assigned. This position includes ensuring the existing operations process is maintained and ensuring a focus on continuous process improvement of both effectiveness and efficiency.

This is a remote role.

Responsibilities

Process Documentation Maintenance:


Maintain process flow diagrams, operation policies & procedures, and operations QA testing plans
Maintain operations checklists and work aids that support the execution of the operations activities
Champion process improvement initiatives in the areas of effectiveness (quality) and efficiency (cost)
Act as the business owner of the technology and tools that support the assigned operations processes
Work closely with operations reporting team to ensure appropriate measurement of the operations processes assigned
Support the implementation of new customers and products

Quality Program Documentation and Testing


Maintain quality testing plans for each operations process area assigned
Maintain testing checklists and work aids that support the execution of the quality tests
Update testing plans to reflect changes to business requirements and incorporate process improvement initiatives
Support the implementation of new customers and products

Production Monitoring/Execution:


Maintain the production management communication cadence (production planning, issue reviews, and production outcomes reporting) within operations, the product organization and full company
Execute operations processes steps and quality testing for the operations areas assigned
Monitor process reporting and quality reporting to identify issues and work to resolve following the issue escalation policies & procedures
Maintain a complete and accurate production issues list

Qualifications

Academic and professional qualifications:


Bachelors degree in related field of study

Experience:


2+ years healthcare technology industry experience
2+ years SQL experience required
Working understanding of product development life cycle
Proven problem-solving skills in the areas of process management and technology

Travel requirements:


All Pulse8 employees attend two company summits per year in various locations.

Working Arrangements:


Monday through Friday or as defined by assignment requirements
This is a remote/virtual position

#LI-ALL

Pulse8 is a stand-alone brand, fully owned by Allscripts, with its own C-level and senior leadership. When you work for Pulse8, you get the advantages and benefits of working with a large, public company with the innovative culture and direction and of a small, nimble company.
At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings.

Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire.

Meet GetUpside:

GetUpside is a digital platform that connects millions of users with tens of thousands of gas stations, restaurants, and grocery stores nationwide. Shoppers know us as the mobile app that offers 2 to 3 times more cash back than anyone else, and brick-and-mortar businesses know us as the platform that's helping them earn more profit than ever before (and proving it). We know ourselves as community-builders. When people and businesses are better off, communities grow stronger.

Meet the Operations team:

The Operations team at GetUpside is a diverse group of team-oriented individuals who are committed to our mission of helping communities thrive. Every day, we strive to maximize the value we provide to consumers and merchants alike by analyzing system performance, rooting out inefficiencies, and delivering on our promises. We value a supportive work environment where we can learn from our mistakes while we tackle the ever-changing challenges that come with supporting a fast-growing business!

What will you do?

As an Analyst on the Merchant Operations team, you'll drive merchant success on GetUpside as we expand nationwide by:


Coordinating merchant onboarding from large enterprise customers (thousands of locations) to SMB merchants (a handful of locations)
Launching new merchant sites (gas, grocery, restaurants) by configuring the system via tools and scripts
Reporting success of the GetUpside program to merchants to ensure continued participation
Running custom ad-hoc analyses to answer merchant questions
Developing standard reporting practices for self-service merchants

You'll also drive GetUpside's operational efficiency to support 30,000+ merchant locations by:


Developing merchant onboarding and maintenance processes to sustain high merchant retention rate while reducing human effort
Developing processes and procedures to improve efficiency and quality of configuring new sites
Analyzing merchant metrics to understand merchant health and to prioritize automation projects
Working with product & engineering teams to automate the onboarding process, configuration tools, and client reports

What do you need?

1-4 years of work experience, preferably in technical project management or technical operations roles
Strong analytical skills, organizational skills, and prioritization skills
A keen eye for detail with an equal focus on process and execution
Process and systems-oriented approach to problem-solving
Self-starter who gets things done
Experience working in a fast-paced environment and interest in doing so at a quickly growing startup!
A constant desire for learning and self-improvement
Unlimited and unrestricted ability to work in the U.S.

The Fine Print:

GetUpside employees are currently working from home during the COVID-19 pandemic. Once it's safe to return to the office, this role will sit full-time at our Austin, Texas, location.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Summary
Travis County uses a county-wide integrated system (SAP on-premise ERP) for finance, procurement and HCM. In addition, we use SAP SuccessFactors in the cloud for Learning and Performance & Goals.

We are looking for a Business Analyst with a strong understanding of human resource processes to join our team. The successful candidate will work closely with business process owners to contribute to new developments and improvements to our human resources (HR) systems, as well as provide ongoing production support.

This position reports to the County Auditor who is the CFO of Travis County government, a $1 billion organization with approximately 6,000 employees. We offer a stable work environment, casual dress attire, quality computer equipment, individual offices, professional development, 11 paid holidays, vacation accrual of up to 3 weeks per year, a flexible start of workday, teleworking policy, excellent pension plan, and an extensive benefits package.
Duties and Responsibilities
Partner with end-users to rollout Learning and Performance & Goals to additional departments.
Write functional specifications for new functionality and enhancements.
Perform SuccessFactors and/or on-premise SAP system configuration to meet business needs.
Identify and solve end-user issues (provide production support).
Perform functional unit/integration/security testing.
Develop end-user procedures, documentation, and training.
Minimum Requirements
Qualifications and Experience:

Required:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, or an HR-related field.
Excellent problem resolution and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge of human resource processes.
Excellent communication, organizational/time management, and interpersonal skills.
Strong team spirit, leadership skills, and the ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Proficient in MS Excel, Outlook, and Teams.
Desired:
2 years of ERP business analyst experience, preferably in SAP or SuccessFactors.
Knowledge of governmental operations.
Experience with projects and process improvement activities.
Experience as a functional business analyst supporting HR-related processes.
Work Environment & Other Information
This job description is intended to be generic in nature. It is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities. The essential duties, functions, and responsibilities and overtime eligibility may vary based on the specific tasks assigned to the position.

A criminal, education, and employment background check is required. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. No visa sponsorships offered.

Candidates who meet the above qualifications are encouraged to apply. Visit Travis County's website to complete an application at: https://www.traviscountytx.gov/human-resources/jobs.

Introduction
IBM’s Industry Consultants are essential to our clients as they work to reinvent themselves for the future. Join our highly visible and highly skilled team of global consultants as we strive to accelerate sales, deliver client engagements, and build IBM’s market eminence. If you are a forward-thinker and a curious intellectual, we welcome you to apply for your next exciting career challenge!

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM Watson Government Health and Human Services is currently searching for a Business Analyst Lead to join our team.

Responsibilities include leading a team of business analysts, implementing and executing an effective requirements analysis methodology aligning to our GHHS Business Analysis Practice, and applying these methodologies in client engagements to translate requirements into meaningful and detailed specifications for technical teams to then design, develop, and implement. You and your team will ensure that deliverables and functionality are clearly defined and testable with measurable acceptance criteria.

Essential Responsibilities:
Accountable for the business analysis functional area, utilizing our best practices and a standard business analysis methodology to be used within the project.
Provides leadership and direction for business analysts engaged in client-facing projects.
In coordination with Practice Lead, determines resource allocations required to meet project demands, adjusts resource plans and resource assignments as needed to adapt to project changes, ensuring staffing levels align with project schedule and budget.
Effectively communicates with and develops/maintains excellent working relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Lead the collection, review, and documentation of client's detailed requirements
Assist in the development of user stories, estimates and work plans
Collaborate with test/QA team to verify the solution is properly configured and extended to meet requirements.
Build a high level of trust and confidence with partners and clients and of proposed solutions.
Successful candidates will possess:
Demonstrated track record of success in leadership role in the analysis and refinement of business requirements for a government Health and Human Services system implementation
Extensive experience facilitating Requirements Analysis Sessions (RAS), or Joint Application Design (JAD) to elicit detailed requirements
Demonstrable experience in developing Requirement Analysis Documentation (RAD) and Requirement Traceability Matricies (RTM)
Proven ability to drive deliverables through life cycles in a structured environment
Demonstrated effective interpersonal ability to collaborate with technical teams, delivery managers, project management, client management and customer stakeholders
If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for this position $115,000 to $178,000 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

5+ years business analysis leadership experience in large-scale IT solution delivery/implementation, preferably for a Health and Human services state government agency (such as Medicaid, TANF, etc.)
Deep subject matter expertise in healthcare data management and analytics OR subject matter expertise in Medicaid or other Human Services
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience utilizing tools such as: Jama, Jira, CA Agile, MSOffice, etc.
Knowledge of query, reporting, database, and analytic business intelligence tools
CMS Certification Experience

About GM
There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.
Why Work for Us
Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.
Job Description
In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM’s global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed and business value.
As a Business Analyst (BA), within the Global Sales, Service, Marketing and Customer Experience IT Organization, you will work side-by-side with business process owners and key stakeholders to identify opportunities and elicit business requirements. You will analyze and evaluate solutions options, facilitate requirements gathering sessions, deliver business value through execution of medium to large projects and develop future strategy To be successful, you must be customer focused, be able to clearly define and communicate business needs, and be personally driven to improve the business.
Major duties / responsibilities:
Project coordination & execution role for Plan and Define as part of the System Development process
Development of business process models, business requirements/user stories (functional and non-functional) and product backlogs
Partners with business to ensure comprehensive user acceptance testing/training plans are developed/executed and application is successfully transitioned to production
Increased understanding of business issues and data challenges of the business
Serves as the requirement's liaison between the business community and the IT teams
Coordinates with Business on Problem and Incident Management
Coordinates project business value/return on investment analysis
Supports IT Strategy Development
Identifies business strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement
Makes recommendations on what projects should be pursued
Perform research on new insights / initiatives the organization may want to pursue
Assists with coordination & representation for Change Requests (CRs)
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge:
In-depth understanding of business analyst fundamentals
In-depth understanding of writing & leading Business Requirements Documents
In-depth understanding of Business Process Modeling
Knowledge in a functional area or business process domain
In-depth understanding of business issues and data challenges of the organization and industry as a whole
In-depth understanding of business process and how application(s) they represent support it
Demonstrates critical skills such as collaboration, strong written and verbal communication skills and analytical capability
Independently facilitates sessions with end users, asking probing questions to elicit business process discussion and capture process flow diagrams
Independently facilitates meetings.
Critical skills:
In-depth business knowledge
Action oriented
Raises issues appropriately
Presents information for decision-making purposes with little to no direction
Increased technical & business insight for planning
Strong time ,management skills
Ability to multi-task i.e. leading multiple projects
Additional Job Description
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree required (technical subject area preferred) or equivalent experience. 7+ years in an applicable business environment.
Proven in-depth understanding of Business Process fundamentals; including requirements elicitation, stakeholder collaboration, effective and timely communications, and problem-solving skills
Experience in IT project management, requirements definition, process definition, testing, and IT strategy and roadmap development.
Expertise in utilizing requirements tools
Experience with Dealer/Customer Business Processes
Experience in troubleshooting and resolving issues
Experience with Agile development methodologies
Good Communication (verbal and written) and analytical skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's Degree in Business, IT, Engineering, or related
Development experience
PMP Certified
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certification

Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
About Pulse8, Inc.
Pulse8 is an innovative Healthcare Analytics and Technology Company that delivers visibility and transparency for Risk Adjustment and Quality Management programs. We enable health plans and at-risk providers to achieve the greatest financial impact in the Health Insurance Exchange (HIX), Medicare Advantage, and Medicaid markets. By combining advanced analytic methodologies with extensive health plan experience, Pulse8 has developed a suite of uniquely pragmatic solutions that are revolutionizing risk adjustment. Pulse8's flexible business intelligence tools offer real-time visibility into member and provider activities so our clients can apply the most cost-effective and appropriate interventions for closing gaps in documentation, coding, and quality.

What's cool about working for Pulse8?

We're a close knit team of Healthcare and Technology experts dedicated to helping people live longer, healthier lives. You'll get to help us design and build innovative solutions from the ground up and have the opportunity to do lots of interesting things in an entrepreneurial culture. We offer competitive benefits and much, much more!


Position Description

The Operations Business Analyst is accountable for maintaining process/technology documentation, quality program documentation and testing, and production monitoring/execution of the areas assigned. This position includes ensuring the existing operations process is maintained and ensuring a focus on continuous process improvement of both effectiveness and efficiency.


This is a remote role.


Responsibilities

Process Documentation Maintenance:

Maintain process flow diagrams, operation policies & procedures, and operations QA testing plans
Maintain operations checklists and work aids that support the execution of the operations activities
Champion process improvement initiatives in the areas of effectiveness (quality) and efficiency (cost)
Act as the business owner of the technology and tools that support the assigned operations processes
Work closely with operations reporting team to ensure appropriate measurement of the operations processes assigned
Support the implementation of new customers and products


Quality Program Documentation and Testing

Maintain quality testing plans for each operations process area assigned
Maintain testing checklists and work aids that support the execution of the quality tests
Update testing plans to reflect changes to business requirements and incorporate process improvement initiatives
Support the implementation of new customers and products


Production Monitoring/Execution:

Maintain the production management communication cadence (production planning, issue reviews, and production outcomes reporting) within operations, the product organization and full company
Execute operations processes steps and quality testing for the operations areas assigned
Monitor process reporting and quality reporting to identify issues and work to resolve following the issue escalation policies & procedures
Maintain a complete and accurate production issues list


Qualifications

Academic and professional qualifications:

Bachelors degree in related field of study


Experience:

2+ years healthcare technology industry experience
2+ years SQL experience required
Working understanding of product development life cycle
Proven problem-solving skills in the areas of process management and technology


Travel requirements:

All Pulse8 employees attend two company summits per year in various locations.


Working Arrangements:

Monday through Friday or as defined by assignment requirements
This is a remote/virtual position

Pulse8 is a stand-alone brand, fully owned by Allscripts, with its own C-level and senior leadership. When you work for Pulse8, you get the advantages and benefits of working with a large, public company with the innovative culture and direction and of a small, nimble company.
At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 postacute organizations across the globe. Calculates commission/incentive award payments to sales personnel based on commission plan provisions.

Business Operations Analyst (Accounting)

at Sony Interactive Entertainment PlayStation

Austin, TX

As a part of Sony Interactive Entertainment, PlayStation is leading the cloud gaming revolution, putting console-quality video games on any device.

As a Business Operations Analyst, you are capable of handling the review, analysis, and approval of costs for the Cloud Gaming Engineering & Infrastructure division (CGEI). You enjoy facing new challenges and the sense of accomplishment from tackling them. Never a dull day, a healthy mix of various projects ensures that the work is both challenging and fast paced.


Responsibilities:

Network Order Management:
Review existing orders and agreements to match against vendors' charges and forecast.
Assist Jr. Analyst in identifying discrepancies and liaise with network engineers/teams to determine validity.
Track life-cycle of orders, update management when orders are due for renewal or termination.
Provide backup support for Jr. Analyst in their duties as AP and vendor liaison.

Vendor Relations: Work with vendor representatives to make adjustments or provide credits when necessary, or to assist various teams with their needs.
Financial Support:
Review departments' purchase requests to align to budget and code accordingly. Work with PM's and management to allocate and obtain approval for additional budget when necessary.

Review monthly financial results and understand variances against each departments' budget.
Identify errors and communicate necessary journal entries to accounting department.

Scorecard Management: Lead measuring supplier performance, identify root causes, and driving improved performance. Drive improvement on all aspects of supplier performance (cost, quality and delivery).

Experience in managing vendor relationships, performance preferred.

Prior experience with Adaptive software is a plus.

Meet GetUpside:

GetUpside is a digital platform that connects millions of users with tens of thousands of gas stations, restaurants, and grocery stores nationwide. Shoppers know us as the mobile app that offers 2 to 3 times more cash back than anyone else, and brick-and-mortar businesses know us as the platform that's helping them earn more profit than ever before (and proving it). We know ourselves as community-builders. When people and businesses are better off, communities grow stronger.

Meet the Operations team:

The Operations team at GetUpside is a diverse group of team-oriented individuals who are committed to our mission of helping communities thrive. Every day, we strive to maximize the value we provide to consumers and merchants alike by analyzing system performance, rooting out inefficiencies, and delivering on our promises. We value a supportive work environment where we can learn from our mistakes while we tackle the ever-changing challenges that come with supporting a fast-growing business!

What will you do?

As an Analyst on the Merchant Operations team, you'll drive merchant success on GetUpside as we expand nationwide by:

Coordinating merchant onboarding from large enterprise customers (thousands of locations) to SMB merchants (a handful of locations)
Launching new merchant sites (gas, grocery, restaurants) by configuring the system via tools and scripts
Reporting success of the GetUpside program to merchants to ensure continued participation
Running custom ad-hoc analyses to answer merchant questions
Developing standard reporting practices for self-service merchants

You'll also drive GetUpside's operational efficiency to support 30,000+ merchant locations by:

Developing merchant onboarding and maintenance processes to sustain high merchant retention rate while reducing human effort
Developing processes and procedures to improve efficiency and quality of configuring new sites
Analyzing merchant metrics to understand merchant health and to prioritize automation projects
Working with product & engineering teams to automate the onboarding process, configuration tools, and client reports

What do you need?

1-4 years of work experience, preferably in technical project management or technical operations roles
Strong analytical skills, organizational skills, and prioritization skills
A keen eye for detail with an equal focus on process and execution
Process and systems-oriented approach to problem-solving
Self-starter who gets things done
Experience working in a fast-paced environment and interest in doing so at a quickly growing startup!
A constant desire for learning and self-improvement
Unlimited and unrestricted ability to work in the U.S.

The Fine Print:

GetUpside employees are currently working from home during the COVID-19 pandemic. Once it's safe to return to the office, this role will sit full-time at our Austin, Texas, location.

Are you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.

Your Role and Responsibilities
As a Business/Marketing Analyst for the Operations team within the IBM Cloud and Cognitive Software business unit, your job will enable stakeholders and leaders to make the right decisions to drive the business to succeed through operational excellence. You will influence organizational models, content planning, contribution & support processes, and take on special projects to help influence organizational excellence and innovation.


Collaboration and communication skills are critical in the role. The team’s success is hinged on its ability to use data to influence IBM's business unit and geography leaders to develop and articulate a comprehensive strategy for our digital offering portfolio.

Your Role and Responsibilities:
Review Operations Manager activities to identify challenges, understand areas for improvements, define requirements, implement changes.
Propose creative and effective solutions to solve challenges; i.e., business process improvements, implement automation, run pilot projects.
Execute tasks as data analysis, business requirements, functional design, specification creation, user training and support.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Knowledge for building responsive and engaging experiences with web technologies.
Skilled in UI development technologies: HTML, CSS, JSON, and API usage
Work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, cost and test innovative applications.
Create systems that provide a great user experience along with security
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Ability to write Cognos reports, use of Excel, knowledge of other reporting tools

We are working to provide the right tools and environment to combine all of our client’s data, no matter where it resides, to respond to changing market dynamics.

Position: Business Analyst
Location: Tustin, CA
Position Summary: This role is the primary subject matter expert on the product that they lead. By working with focus groups, communicating with end users, and conducting competing market research this role takes ownerships of evolving the product to meet business vision and end user expectation. By creating the requirements for all future enhancements, GoGo Business Analysts become the key asset for designers, dev, QA, training and support to fully implement each teams’ goals. This role acts as Product owner for each platform and has a primary goal or optimal end user experience.
Responsibilities:
Be fully aware of the backlog’s health and manage the progress and maintenance.
Work with the Director to understand the business vision and expectations.
Present new ideas, tools, and resources to improve the product evolution process.
Create and maintain the product roadmaps, with consideration of efforts, sizing, dependencies, compliance requirements. Etc.
Be present for your team, as they will look to you for guidance on the products and feature workflows.
Takes initiative to respond to all team messages, TFS comments, and emails to ensure that development continues to move forward.
Help team with removing impediments and blockers where you can aid.
Work closely with NAF legal to team to ensure that our product is continuing to stay compliant.
Work on backlog and stories and feature readiness by partnering up with support and training and clients and any other business units.

Play a large role in UAT to ensure a successful release.
Maintain a positive and excited attitude so your team feeds off that energy.
Do not wait to be approached by business, always come to business first.

job_title: Customer Success Principle Business Analyst - Tableau
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
What you’ll be doing…
The Customer Success Principle Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the analytics needs for programs to drive customer retention in our Customer Success and Renewals business. This role will play a critical role in developing a framework for scalable reporting, partner with Program Managers and leadership to build ROI (Return on investment) models to support strategic investments and establish a framework to measure impact of programs. You will develop data assets and dashboards that represent the official view of our business. Based in Seattle, you will have a unique focus on the needs of our AMER (North and South American) customers, while closely aligning coordinating efforts with the business analysts based in our APJ and EMEA theaters. You will be a team lead on a small team of in-theater analysts, with an eye towards a future management position. In addition, you will provide ongoing support to better understand performance drivers on customer retention and identify areas of opportunity. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will conduct in‐depth performance analysis, provide data artifacts, and the packaging of findings/recommendations into presentation‐ready content for leadership. You will be closely aligned with the Customer Solutions Analytics and Insights team to leverage best practices and methodologies.
Some of the things you’ll be doing include…
Create informative and actionable insights that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement.
Collect, analyze, evaluate, and report data to performance and metrics.
Server as team lead for the business analysts, leading 3-4 other analysts on best practices and global alignment and coordination.
Develop and maintain standardized operational reports and dashboards to monitor overall region/customer health, data integrity, and other key objectives and performance indicators.
Build processes and reporting packages to empower Program Managers and leaders on most impactful programs and identify areas of opportunity.
Collaborate cross departmentally to improve or define processes that promote data integrity and reporting functionality.
Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Support day‐to‐day inquiries from the team, providing prompt and efficient resolution to a wide range of issues and developing operational procedures.
Collaborate cross‐functionally within the Customer Solutions Analytics and Insights organization to ensure consistent reporting standards and processes.
Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues.
Who you are ...
Experience. 7+ years of experience as a data analyst in consulting, finance, sales operations, or product management. Prior experience in a subscription software environment is a plus.
Technically Savvy . Prior experience in Tableau Software required. Strong knowledge of relational database technologies, Excel, and ability to become an expert in Tableau Software’s full product suite. SQL and Financial modeling is a plus
Domain. Ability to understand and anticipate the needs of a subscription software business, and a strong curiosity to deepen that understanding.
Detail oriented. Analytical and inquisitive. Excellent organizational skills and must be able to work independently with limited guidance.
Team Player. Ability to work independently and with others.
Data Rock Star. Proven ability to create scalable and repeatable analytics. Ability to glean insight from data and the wherewithal to develop findings and recommendations.
Energy and Creativity . Demonstrated success as a highly creative, curious technologist and problem solver.
Performer. Demonstrated ability to juggle and prioritize a high-volume workload while handling details accurately, in a timely manner, and under pressure. Demonstrated strong time management skills, with the ability to multi‐task, handle frequent interruptions, and make decisions in a fast-paced environment.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!
