Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati is the premier legal advisor to technology, life sciences, and other growth enterprises worldwide. We represent companies at every stage of development, from entrepreneurial start-ups to multibillion-dollar global corporations, as well as the venture firms, private equity firms, and investment banks that finance and advise them. The firm has approximately 950 attorneys in 16 offices: 11 in the U.S., three in China, and two in Europe. Our broad spectrum of practices and entrepreneurial spirit allow our staff exceptional opportunities for professional achievement and career growth.
The firm is seeking a Business Development Analyst for the Corporate Department. The position's core function is to provide essential tactical support to the fast-paced Business Development team that drives business development and marketing for the firm’s global Emerging Companies Practice (ECP). The position reports to the Marketing Manager for the ECP.


Position is ideally based in our New York, Boston or Austin offices, but other locations in which Wilson Sonsini has an office will be considered.


Responsibilities Include:
Support and drive marketing and business development initiatives across the ECP and multiple groups, including the Environmental, Social and Governance group and Cleantech group
Prepare compelling marketing and business development collateral, including basic and highly tailored pitch materials
Conduct in-depth research on markets, technologies, companies, and individuals for ECP attorneys
Support the Business Development team’s pitch tracking and reporting activities
Help track and maintain key attorney matters for the experience database
Provide weekly geographic VC deal reports to select offices
Participate in the successful production and execution of client events, speaking engagements, and sponsorships, including analyzing attendee lists, preparing tailored materials, supporting attorney follow-up, and tracking outcomes and activities in the CRM system
Collaborate with the ECP leadership to support and drive practice and technology innovation initiatives

Desired Skills and Qualifications:
Minimum of three years of experience in a law firm business development function supporting corporate practice groups; experience supporting venture capital practices a big plus
Bachelor’s degree required
Strong customer service ethic
Exemplary communication skills, both verbal and written
Extremely detail-oriented, with superior proofreading and fact checking skills
Efficient, highly organized and able to stay productive under pressure with tight deadlines
Proficient in the use of PowerPoint, Word, Excel, and database applications
Aptitude for learning new software, systems and procedures quickly
Exceptional online search skills and a deep curiosity about technology, life sciences and the new energy economy
Able to work independently and in team environments
Self-motivated and positive attitude
Able to travel to other offices occasionally as needed

We offer a highly competitive salary and benefits package.

Position Overview: Deep Labs is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our growing team as we enter our next phase of growth. We are looking for a professional who has experience working in a fast-growing technology startup environment.
You are the extrovert at the party who loves connecting with others and telling stories. You bring those skills to the workplace by truly enjoying interfacing with internal and external stakeholders to develop requirements, translate between teams, and create narratives. You’ve got technical chops, but you prefer thinking in terms of the big picture and feel a sense of pride when you’ve successfully driven a project to completion. You prefer your stories to be visually engaging whether it’s on the whiteboard, in PowerPoint, or built in Tableau because you understand that the only way to bring your ideas to life is to communicate them in a way the audience can grasp. This role reports to the Director of Data Science.


Our Mission: At Deep Labs, we believe Persona-Based Intelligence is the next generation of true context-aware computing. Our mission is to be the world leader in the delivery of persona-based decisions through innovation and technology, helping our clients make faster and better decisions while improving customer experience.


Our People: We are a global group of unique, accomplished professionals who value the sharing of ideas, respect our diverse differences and values, are trusted advisors, yearn to create meaningful change, and explore opportunities to improve. We support each other and know that each win is a win for us all. Our people are our most valuable asset. Guided by our Core Values, we foster an environment that attracts and engages our people to achieve their full potential, individually and as a team.
Responsibilities:

Work closely with key stakeholders including Business Partners, business sponsors, product owners, development and support teams, and other parties involved in the successful scoping, development, testing, delivery, implementation, and onboarding of the systems and applications
Elicit and document requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, user stories task and workflow analysis
Develop graphics and analytics with BI tools to transform data into actionable intelligence
Provide the primary point of coordination between local market delivery teams and global delivery teams
Coordinate and oversee stakeholder engagement activities, ensuring continued alignment with local and global strategies
Work with local markets to define, structure and deliver against a phased program of work based on a generic plan which is tailored to individual markets
Ensure a continued focus on successful delivery and providing genuine business value and benefits (i.e., business benefits rather than just technical delivery)

Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in STEM subjects with demonstrable IT skills preferred
Minimum 5 years commercial experience in a Business Analyst role
Business Analysis skillset - a deep experience of agile and traditional business analysis techniques - business process modeling, scenarios, user stories, use cases, acceptance criteria, non-functional analysis, etc.
Able to delve into the detail whilst maintaining sight of the bigger picture
A proactive “can do” attitude and a willingness to be “hands-on” when required
Proven stakeholder management skills working with all levels of an organization
Strong business process mapping and data analysis
Business case development and benefits realization experience
Strong planning, problem-solving and decision-making skills
Highly developed organizational skills with excellent time and expectation management skills


Specific Skills:

Experience working with enterprise BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI
Experience in SQL
Experience with open-source visualization packages such as Dash, Shiny a plus
Experience in Python a plus


Why Deep Labs?

At Deep Labs there is tremendous potential to learn, while also contributing to policies, decisions, and the direction of the company. An opportunity to work with industry leaders with 100 years of experience at Visa, PayPal, Intuit, Bank of America, JP Morgan Chase and Booz Allen Hamilton. We offer a great compensation package and benefits and provide an open, honest, and fun work environment.

Manos Home Care assists people with disabilities and illnesses in their activities of daily living. Our service takes place in client’s homes and their immediate surroundings. Seattle, WA & San Francisco, CA (REMOTE, until otherwise noted)

About the Role. . .

Our Digital Transformation team is looking for seasoned Business Systems Analysts to work with cutting-edge technologies and interesting companies in a fast-paced, exciting environment. These Business Systems Analysts will participate in projects supporting one or more work streams and multiple business teams. You will need to have effective communication and a wide variety of skills to support or lead activities, including gathering, analyzing, and documenting stakeholder requirements (developing Process Maps/ Wire Frames/ Feature Acceptance Criteria/ User Stories), and collaborating closely with technical teams to ensure delivered solutions meet business needs.

At the same time, you’ll be joining a five-time “Best Company to Work For,” where intelligent, talented people come together to do outstanding work—and have a lot of fun while they’re at it. Because we’re a full-service consulting firm with a diverse client base, you can count on a steady stream of opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies on projects that make a real difference. Logic20/20's Global Delivery Model creates a connected experience for Logicians across geographies. You'll have access to projects in different locations, the technology to support Connected Teams, and in-person and online culture in our Connected Hub cities.

The Logic20/20 Digital Transformation team is where innovation comes to life. We apply design thinking and next-gen technologies to solve our clients’ toughest business challenges in ways they never dreamed possible. You’ll work side-by-side with various architecture, manager, and engineering consultants to gain a 360-degree perspective of the challenge at hand, while contributing your unique perspective to develop innovative solutions. And when you want to expand your horizons, we’ve got you covered. You’ll have opportunities to shape the next chapter of your career by getting hands-on experience with emerging technologies like RPA, virtual assistants, and more.

You Have. . .

Relevant work experience in evaluating business systems, project execution, or technology – empowering business through robust technology improvements. Experience managing ambiguity and complexity in unstructured operating environments, while able to navigate in larger, more structured environments. Experience with and ability to quickly develop and in-depth understanding of business rules and processes to the extent of being able to optimize/streamline the workflows. Ability to clearly communicate sophisticated concepts to the clients and project team. Experience in one or more SDLC methodology (i.e. Waterfall, Agile, Scrum), and ability to work within the process. Proficiency with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and experience with Visio

Qualifications. . .

Have worked for a Big 4/8 management consulting firmAn undergraduate degree (BA/BS) in business or technology SDLC methodologies3-5+ years in BSA type roles (not exclusively or predominantly testing) A high degree of creativity and innovation, with proven examples of applying knowledge, experience, and judgment to ambiguous problems. Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills; must be very comfortable with data Strong consensus-building skills between business and technology partners Detail-oriented and believe that details matter greatly to the success of the solution Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills The aptitude to see and think through complex end-to-end enterprise processes and system flows

About Logic20/20. . .

Logic20/20 is one of Seattle’s fastest-growing consulting firms. We hire remarkable people to create simple, efficient solutions for complex problems.

Although we make it look like magic, our success is due to our approach (methodical and structured) and the people we hire (smart, motivated, and team oriented). Together, these enable us to consistently exceed client expectations—and our reputation is growing.

For the past five years, we’ve placed in the top ten of Seattle Business magazine’s “Best Companies to Work For”. From engaged leadership and wide-ranging benefits to career mentorship and diverse internal opportunities, we pride ourselves on being one of the best companies to work with and work for.

We hire people that are self-motivated, comfortable conceiving strategies on the fly, and enjoy working individually and as part of a team. We bring our best to every opportunity, driving change in industries across the West Coast. Join us and you can, too.

Title: IT Business Analyst (Asset Management)

Location: San Francisco, CA

This position will be a member of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco Information Technology (FRBSF - IT) Asset Management Team responsible for the centralized IT Asset Management function. The Federal Reserve has a global mission and offers leading edge work in a stable environment with competitive pay, superior benefits AND a true "work life balance". If you desire to be part of an elite team and to develop your skills and experience beyond anything available in the commercial sector, the Federal Reserve is the place for you!

The successful candidate should have proven experience systematically supporting the Lead Project Manager in the management of assets through their life cycle. This individual must demonstrate attention to detail and an ability to evaluate and analyze complex information in a timely manner. The individual will work closely with IT teams, Business Groups, and end-users to ensure the proper accountabilities and controls are in place to ensure compliance with written guidelines and licensing requirements.

Highlights of Responsibilities:

Day-to-day asset management life-cycle support for procurement, deployment, maintenance and disposal of IT assets. Ensure accuracy and timeliness of asset identification, tracking and record attributes for improved reporting and analytics. Perform regular reconciliations of IT assets and inventory records. Conduct and/or facilitate inventory activities as required. Verify the inventory of assets and provide status reports on the inventory and changes on a scheduled basis. Support projects and programs to enhance Asset Management function's ability to manage IT assets as well as ensure compliance with applicable local and System policies and written guidelines, including licensing requirements. Develop and update process flows, diagrams, and narratives. Understand the impact that asset changes and replacements have on the overall business case for asset management and solution. Acts as a liaison between IT Asset Management and Business Groups and serve as a subject matter expert on any asset inventory related initiatives, communications, validation of proper disposals and any other issues. Engage various stakeholders such as IT teams, Business Group Liaisons, and end-users to help collect, coordinate, and manage assets. Manage the administration of the status reporting, metrics and benchmarks. Collaborate with P+C (HR), Business Group Liaisons, and IT Teams to define asset needs and serves as the interface during on/off-boarding, renewals and upgrades to ensure the assets are handled and recorded timely and efficiently. Assist in monitoring and forecasting of IT asset inventory and prepare reporting on a periodic basis for management and Business Groups. Work closely with the Financial Management team to ensure proper and timely payment processing and budget reconciliation. Identify impacts across teams and coordinate across senior levels to handle dependencies and potentially ambitious priorities.

Position Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Business, information technology or any technical related field, or equivalent work experience. Background and understanding of IT processes and infrastructure, including but not limited to IT Asset Management with a focus on inventory life cycle, practices and Management. Proven ability to quickly learn and understand complex topics. Strong project management, analytical and research skills with a demonstrated ability to manage projects from inception through completion. Good time management skills. Ability to manage or participate in multiple tasks/projects simultaneously and prioritize effectively. Possess a professional attitude and work ethic in addition to the ability to work well in a team environment and collaborate with multiple stakeholders as well as independently as a catalyst with minimal guidance and supervision. Ability to deal with unforeseen situations and demonstrated problem-solving skills with a high level of initiative and attention to detail and a strong focus on accuracy. Excellent business communication skills to effectively document results, instructions, and recommendations, with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate basic technical information verbally and in writing to non-technical personnel. Strong proficiency with data analysis and reporting skills. Experience with data visualizations hosted on web-based platforms e.g. Tableau, and Power BI Minimum 2 years' experience in providing product and asset procurement and management. Experience with MS Excel, MS Access, or similar data analytics tools. Experience with CMBD, SCCM, or other Asset Management tools. Experience with ServiceNow is a huge plus. Certified IT Asset Manager (CITAM) a plus. Applicant must be a U.S. citizen or a Green carder holder with intent to become a U.S. citizen.

High end business analysis, verbal and written skills are a must for this position and should be able to work independently.Responsibilities Include:Schedule and meet with stakeholders, system owners, and end users to define business requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve business process issues.Assist in the planning, design, development, testing and deployment of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.Develop training documentation and conduct team and end-user training as required.Contribute to project estimation efforts - providing input/clarity on business requirements and options to implement those requirements.Work in a team environment and support various groups.Coordinate and perform in-depth testing, including end-user reviews for modified and new systems. Work with users and technical developers on creating robust test plans/conditions and executing to the plan and capturing results.Participate in management discussions and prioritize user request.Contribute to effective project planning, participation in implementation, ensure adherence to quality and schedule.Job Requirements:Bachelors and/or Masters Degree in Business, MIS, Engineering or equivalent experience.Ability to write clear functional requirements to a level of detail that facilitates the development and implementation of system enhancements.Ability to think logically and analyze business process requirements and accurately convert them to design specifications.Technical background is a must for this position.Ability to collaborate with business users and manage vendors effectively.Ability to quickly learn new systems/tools and become the *Go To* resource.Effective communication (written and verbal) and organizational skills.Strong interpersonal, team building skills and customer facing experience.Strong problem solving and issue resolution experience is a must.Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment with developers and business users.Ability to foster a positive and constructive relationship with team members.Have a strong desire to excelPrefer U.S. Citizens OR Green Card holders. PlayStation isn't just the Best Place to Play —it's also the Best Place to Work. We've thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original PlayStation. Today, we're recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.
Business Analyst, Data Governance- San Mateo

At Sony Interactive Entertainment (SIE), data is a critical business asset that facilitates business operations, empowers decision making, and provides vital insights into improvement and innovation of PlayStation products and services. With exponential data growth brought on by PlayStation's success, the Data Governance and Literacy team is tasked with the mission to instill a culture of responsible and effective use of data. This is accomplished by governing data as a valuable enterprise asset and continuously elevating the organization's data literacy. With an initial focus on data privacy and data sharing, this role focuses on executing data governance processes to advance the understanding of and compliance with data handling policies within SIE as well as across broader Sony.Responsibilities:

Operationalize data governance by managing the rollout of data stewardship to select business units within SIE
Be a trusted partner to assigned business units by building domain expertise, by understanding their rhythm of business, and by offering balanced advisory. Assist as needed in the development of meaningful data handling policies, standards, and guidelines
Facilitate global privacy reviews at scale - a key data governance process designed to instill proactive thinking of privacy implications pertaining to a business unit's data activities
Develop and maintain strong relationships with partners of the privacy review process (e.g. business units, privacy attorneys) by ensuring that using data flow diagrams, all parties involved in the process have a thorough understanding of relevant data operations, that necessary information for the privacy reviews is provided and that the reviews are conducted on a timely basis
Maintain and scale documentation of privacy reviews, including data flow diagrams, assessment notes and outcomes, and inventories of systems and activities
Take a metrics-based approach and a continuous improvement attitude to data stewardship operations including but not limited to achieving privacy compliance at scale

Qualifications:



5+ years work experience in a data-intensive environment at a consumer-focused product or services company
2+ years experience executing cross-functional organizational processes in data governance/ stewardship, privacy operations, privacy regulatory compliance, security GRC, or trust & safety function
Experience with issue/ project-tracking and content management tools like Jira, OneTrust and Confluence
Strong communication, interpersonal and influencing skills with proven ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams
An analytical mind, a strong sense of ownership, and a bias for structure and action
Passion and energy for working in the video gaming industry
Broad understanding of database concepts
Bachelor's degree or above

PRIVACY NOTICE TO SIE LLC'S JOB APPLICANTS

This Privacy Notice explains what personal information we at Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC collect from you, and why we collect it and use it. This Notice covers our practices regarding the personal information of all applicants to our job positions. Please review it carefully.

Categories of personal information we collect from you

We collect personal information about you throughout the recruiting process, in particular the following categories. Generally, we obtain this information through our Recruiting Team:

A. Identification and contact information



Direct identifiers such as your first and last name.

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming an entire industry through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency holds companies accountable to strive to become better employers.

We are searching for a Sr. Business Systems Analyst to join our Business Application team at Glassdoor. Our team delivers the capability that fuels the growth and efficiency at Glassdoor.

This position is an individual contributor role and will collaborate closely with and report to the Manager, Business Applications. We welcome remote hiring, with our main office locations in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL and Uniontown, OH.

We're looking for someone that will further cultivate and nurture a deep partnership and highly productive consultative relationship with Glassdoor's internal business partners. You will be responsible for understanding the Glassdoor business and its operations, excelling at translating business needs from Finance, Sales Operations, and Product business teams into robust & scalable technical solutions.

This position will additionally work on a portfolio of exciting Business Application projects & services, with a focus on Glassdoor's global Finance, Accounting, and FP&A functions, providing structure & leadership to process optimization projects as well as deep expertise in developing new or improving existing workflows.

Expect to be integral in supporting key business processes across Glassdoor and to be charged with analyzing and implementing best practices / standard methodologies across key financial systems including NetSuite and Salesforce, inclusive of automating repetitive, low-value manual work.Responsibilities include:

Maintaining the relationship between Finance and IT to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.
Functioning as a FinTech Product Manager and partner to model, design, and build business solutions that improve Glassdoor's Finance processes.
Working closely with multi-functional partners including Finance, Sales Operations, Product & Engineering, leading the charge with projects from inception through delivery, including taking point on providing status updates, balancing budgets, and efficiently & effectively navigating scope changes.
Responding to issues & incidents, providing day-to-day administration and support of NetSuite, Coupa, Zuora, and RevPro and ideally Salesforce.com.
Actively monitoring systems and integrations for issues, finding opportunities for improvement in processes, data, or systematic solutions.
Partnering with business leadership, both internal & external development resources, as well as suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutions.
Collaborating with offshore application development teams to develop new solutions and run User Acceptance Testing with your business groups
Developing and maintaining documentation on both current and new system processes and flows.

Basic Qualifications:



Hands-on experience with NetSuite ERP is required.
Bachelor's degree in the field of computer science or information systems.
2+ years of experience with NetSuite required
5+ experience in IT analysis, design and development of complex ERP solutions.
5+ years of technical experience and project management in a fast-growing, technology organization, preferably cloud-based (SaaS) product delivery.
Deep understanding of key financial business processes (Quote-to-Cash, Billing, Collections, Revenue Management, Procure-to-Pay).
Exceptional problem solving and analytical/critical thinking skills needed, as well as outstanding interpersonal skills.
Effective communication with exceptional active listening skills, with a proven record of successfully conveying complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to both technical and non-technical audiences alike.
You will obsess - in a good way! - over performance, user experience, and efficiency.
Administrator level knowledge and experience of roles, permissions, custom objects, scripting, workflows, reports, and dashboards
Work directly with internal/external developers, NetSuite and/or other Professional Services organization to properly configure modules and integrations
Actively identify issues and propose solutions to solve business needs through new configurations, workflows, or customizations

Preferred Qualifications:



We'd love to see an in-depth understanding of Netsuite's capabilities and constraints.
Experience with Salesforce, Boomi, or RevPro is a plus!
SaaS business model experience in a hyper-growth environment strongly preferred.
NetSuite Administrator Certification.
Netsuite ERP Certification.

Why Glassdoor?

Work with purpose join us in creating transparency for job seekers everywhere
100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage
Long Term Incentive Plan
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off

Our Commitments

A values-based culture: Our values are Transparency, Innovation, Good People and Grit. We look for talented, passionate people who embody these values in how they show up to work every day.
Pay transparency: We believe that with more salary transparency, you hold the information to ensure fair pay now and in the future as your career changes and grows. Pay bands and our compensation philosophy are shared publicly to ensure that everyone is paid fairly. Our annual Pay Gap Study found no gender or race/ethnicity pay gap at Glassdoor.
Diversity & Inclusion transparency: We are committed to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our commitment. We also provide programs and resources to create a greater sense of belonging for our employees.
Employee feedback transparency: We believe in providing you with greater insight into what it is really like to work with us. In addition to our Glassdoor Reviews, we publicly publish our employee feedback survey responses to ensure everyone has a complete picture of what it's like to work here.
Company performance transparency: We believe you should know how your work contributes to moving the company forward. That's why we share detailed business performance updates in our monthly All Hands and deeper financial results every quarter. For more insight into the performance of our parent company, you can explore the financial results of Recruit Holdings, and its HR Technology segment in particular, each quarter. Operating transparently at Glassdoor is fundamental as we advocate for transparency in the broader workforce. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!

Glassdoor is an equal opportunity employer; committed to creating a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

IntroductionThe following information describes the civil service classification for which applications are being solicited.Make sure you read the entire announcement before completing the application form.The purpose of this examination announcement is to establish an eligible list for this classification.This is a Position-Based Test conducted in accordance with CSC Rule 111APOSITION DESCRIPTIONUnder the general direction of the Performance and Analytics Manager, the IS Business Analyst-Principal is responsible for providing technical and analytic support for business intelligence systems and software applications. The MTA Performance Section is responsible for collecting and reporting agency-wide performance data, managing enterprise self-service analytics, facilitating operational performance management, and providing analytical support across the agency.The IS Business Analyst-Principal will perform functional tasks such as business process and systems analysis, testing, and user support for tools such as Tableau and Alteryx. The IS Business Analyst- Principal will also perform technical tasks such as report, query and dashboard development, data extract, load and transformation, metadata modeling, tuning, and troubleshooting. Finally, the IS Business Analyst-Principal is responsible for leading an agency-wide data governance effort.The essential functions of this position include:Review data processing and workflow needs for the Performance Section to identify efficiencies in current technology and/or the procurement of new technology.Leads the technical support for business intelligence systems and software applications (data processing, reports, and troubleshooting) such as Tableau and Alteryx.Organize the collaborative development of data sources and secure the appropriate levels of agreement and sign-off.Manages relationship with IT staff to develop/amend projects that would facilitate data access to the organization.Monitors business data processes by tracking performance, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, recommending improvement actions.Performs related duties as required.Minimum QualificationsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:1. An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) quarter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field]; AND2. Five (5) years of experience in the information systems field, including system analysis, business process design, development and implementation of business application solutions or IT project management. Four (4) of these years must have included experience conducting complex financial analysis in Tableau building interactive web visualizationsSubstitution: Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). One (1) year is equivalent to thirty (30) semester units / forty-five (45) quarter units with a minimum of 10 semester / 15 quarter units in computer science or a closely related field. Additional experience may not substitute for the required four (4) years of Tableau experience as described aboveThe above minimum qualifications reflect special conditions associated with the position(s) to be filled. They may differ from the standard minimum qualifications associated with this classification.Desirable QualificationsExperience with a variety of business intelligence systems or data visualization software.Ability to lead projects with a proven track record implementing automated systems.Knowledge of data governance best practices.Additional Note:Make sure your application and any attachments to the application submitted at the time of filing are complete and accurate and include details on all experience, education, training and other information that qualifies you for this recruitment. Failure to submit a complete and accurate application at the time of filing may result in your ineligibility for this recruitment or inability to receive full credit for scoring purposes. Any new information concerning work experience, education, training and other information that is submitted after the filing deadline may not be used for scoring or considered to determine whether you meet the minimum qualifications. Applications completed improperly may be cause for ineligibility, disqualification or may lead to lower scores.How To ApplyCity and County of San Francisco employment applications for this position will be accepted through an online process only. Visit www.jobapscloud.com/sf to begin the application process.Click and select 1054 IS Business Analyst - Principal (PBT-1054-109290)Click “Apply” and read and acknowledge the informationClick on either “I am a New User” if you have not previously registered, or “I have Registered Previously”Follow instructions on the screenIn order to comply with social distancing guidelines due to COVID-19, staff is working remotely at this time. As a result, the Department of Human Resources (DHR)’s and SFMTA’s Human Resources offices are currently closed to the general public. We highly recommend applications be completed early. If you are having difficulty submitting your application online, please contact us at 415-701-5413 between 8:30 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. and 1:00 p.m. - 4:30 p.m. Monday through Friday or by e-mail at Matthew.Hurd@sfmta.com.Applicants may be contacted by email about this announcement and, therefore, it is their responsibility to ensure that their registered email address is accurate and kept up-to-date. Also, applicants must ensure that email from CCSF is not blocked on their computer by a spam filter. Written verification (proof) of qualifying experience must verify that the applicant meets the minimum qualifications stated on the examination announcement. Credit for experience obtained outside of the employee’s class will be allowed only if recorded in accordance with the provisions of the Civil Service Commission Rules. Experience claimed in self-employment must be supported by documents verifying income, earnings, business license and experience comparable to the minimum qualifications of the position. Copies of income tax papers or other documents listing occupations and total earnings must be submitted. If education verification is required, information on how to verify education requirements, including verifying foreign education credits or degree equivalency, can be found at http://sfdhr.org/how-verify-education-requirements .Note: Falsifying one’s education, training, or work experience or attempted deception on the application may result in disqualification for this and future job opportunities with the City and County of San Francisco.Selection PlanMinimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire (Weight: Qualifying):Candidates will be prompted to complete a Supplemental Questionnaire as part of the online employment application. This Minimum Qualification Supplemental Questionnaire is designed to obtain specific information regarding an applicant's experience in relation to the Minimum Qualifications for this position. The Supplemental Questionnaire is designed to measure knowledge, skills and/or abilities in job-related areas for 1054 IS Business Analyst - Principal.A passing score must be achieved on the Supplemental Questionnaire in order to be ranked on the eligible list. The department may administer additional position-specific selection procedures to make final hiring decisions.Candidate scores on this examination may also be applied to other announcements involving other job titles, when directed by the Human Resources Director.CERTIFICATION RULEThe certification rule used for the eligible list resulting from this selection process will be the Rule of Three (3) Scores. The hiring department may conduct additional selection processes to make final hiring decisions.ELIGIBLE LISTA confidential eligible list of applicant names that have passed the civil service examination process will be created and used for certification purposes only. Applicant information, including names of applicants on the eligible list, shall not be made public unless required by law. However, an eligible list shall be made available for public inspection, upon request, once the eligible list is exhausted or expired and referrals resolved. The eligible list/score report resulting from this civil service examination process is subject to change after adoption (e.g., as a result of appeals), as directed by the Director of Transportation or the Civil Service Commission.The duration of the eligible list resulting from this examination will be six (6) months and may be extended with the approval of the Director of Transportation.Conviction HistoryAs a selected candidate for a job, you will be fingerprinted, and your fingerprints will be sent to the California Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI). The resulting report of your conviction history (if any) will be used to determine whether the nature of your conviction (or arrest, in limited circumstances) conflicts with the specific duties and responsibilities of the job for which you are a selected candidate. Employment with the City requires the affirmation of a loyalty oath to this effect. [Note: The correction of clerical errors in an announcement may be posted on the Department of Human Resources website at www.jobapscloud.com/sf.] The terms of this announcement may be appealed under Civil Service Rule 411A.35.1. The standard for the review of such appeals is 'abuse of discretion' or 'no rational basis' for establishing the position description, the minimum qualifications and/or the certification rule. Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If youre passionate about joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay a company you'll be proud to be a part of.

The Global Payments, Billing & Risk (GPBR) team is responsible for designing and building eBay's first ever payments platform. We aspire to enable exemplary customer experiences, where our buyers and sellers can come together and engage in commerce on the biggest marketplace in the world.

You play a meaningful role by partnering with internal teams and external organizations to optimize payments globally for buyer conversion, seller enablement, and cost/risk performance effectively. You will have extensive experience in global ecommerce payments, exceptional structured thinking, ability to synthesize and make recommendations driven by imperfect data from multiple sources (internally and externally), strong business intuition to guide their analysis, and ability to work both independently and cross-functionally. You will be responsible for translating strategy to execution and working cross functionally with product, engineering, analytics, regions, segments, and more to bring solutions to life.

Key Responsibilities:

Define, own, and drive the core metrics enabling global payments success
Analyzing key payment metrics and identifies actionable optimizations with the goal of improving the customer experience and payments performance
Work cross functionally through planning, execution, performance analysis, and ongoing optimization of our payments capabilities
Understand market leading global payment solutions and trends to inform strategy and potential opportunities for optimization
Develop requirements needed to execute on strategic vision
Collaborate with product managers and engineering to build-out critical payments platforms
Forge new and enhance existing global payments and strategic relationships; manage contractual and technical development and negotiation
Build in-depth regional and product expertise and build business cases backed with serious analytical horsepower
Monitoring notifications from Vendor Partners and communicates impacts to appropriate departments and partners
Helping our internal global teams with payment processing related issues
Acting as a liaison with both vendors and internal teams
Monitoring Cost of Payments; executing Partner audits
Evaluating Vendor Partner performance and maintaining Vendor Partner Scorecards

Preferred Qualifications

BS required, MBA preferred
3-5 years in ecommerce, payments, cross border, and payment networks
3+ years in product management, program management, and/or go-to-market roles
Strong business insight and technical aptitude ability to deep dive with product partners as needed
Ability to clearly articulate a vision, gain key partner agreement, and lead teams through influence
Successfully manage & build relationships with internal and external partners
Have the art of managing without authority, ability to execute and influence outside the direct organization
Provide insights and recommendations based on customer feedback and analytics
Experience and an understanding of the global payments ecosystem and Fx
Strong ability to build financial models and related scenario analyses
Team player who can manage projects in a dynamic work environment
SQL/analytical skills

Recommendations

Proven, proficient experience in project management
Strong, structured solution driven mindset
Executive-level presentation and communication skills
Ability to analyze large data sets
Comfort in managing through ambiguity
Successfully operated in progressively senior leadership roles in a dynamic, global, matrix environment

Job Title: Data Analyst - Business IntegrityLocation: Seattle, CADuration: 6 MonthsSummary:Business Integrity: Actor understandingThe Actor understanding team focuses on malicious business models and business actors. Specifically we address things like business impersonation, business compromise, and other user harm (scams, misleading experiences, low quality e-commerce, etc..).Business Integrities goal is to protect users from bad experiences while also protecting both Facebook and good advertisers from these malicious business models.Job Description/Scope:o There are 2 rolesBusiness Impersonation –The DS in this role will focus on expanding our understanding and measurement of impersonation prevalence across our business eco-system.Day-to-day work will involve investigation and exploration of data leveraging our business graph, user search data, and various model/signal scores.From this investigation descriptive analyses used to inform the product teams as well as prevalence and operational measures will be expected deliverables.Business Compromise –The DS in this role will focus on improving our detection and mitigation techniques.Bad actors focused on compromising active businesses use numerous strategies to engage with and take over business assets.Day to day work will include evaluating these tactics and completing exploratory analyses to understand product features and changes which may restrict or even prevent users from leveraging these strategies againDescriptive analyses, product recommendations, and operational metrics will be common deliverables from this role.QUALIFICATIONSStrong SQL skillsStrong analytic programming skills in R or PythonComfort manipulating large data structures and basic pipeline developmentExploratory and descriptive statistical analyses as well as comfort with data visualizations.\\SQLPython/RInvestigative/exploratory/descriptive statistical skillsTop Preferred/Like to Have Skills:Experience with business/financial fraudExperience with forensic/investigative statistical methods2-3 years as a data scientist or statistical analystIND123

job_title: Sr Business Analysis Manager, Digital Strategic Analysis
description: Come join our Digital Strategy & Planning team! As a Sr. Business Analysis Manager, you will lead strategic analysis that drives decisions and the performance of T-Mobile’s Digital organization. You are responsible for structuring business problems, crafting analysis models, extracting and analyzing data, providing insights, constructing presentations and presenting complex analytical findings in a clear, concise, and decision-impacting manner. Return on investment decisions for product, demand, capacity, and customer experience are driven by your analysis. High discernment, understanding of T-Mobile’s business and strategic priorities, and an ability to clearly and concisely explain performance and investment decisions are required. Additionally, you are driven by a strong sense of curiosity and a growth approach. The ability to work cross-functionally to gather information and inspire change are significant for success.Who you are:To be successful in this role you will need to be a self-starter and have a passion for learning. You are highly strategic and comfortable thinking in 3-5 year timeframes, which you balance with a strong bias for action, a sense of responsibility, and persistence for hitting near-term objectives. You see the big picture, as well as how it comes together, through a toolbox of mental models and in-depth analysis. You are highly skilled at data extraction & manipulation and possess an unbridled curiosity to search out and dig up the information you need from disparate sources so you can meet your goals. You have excellent writing and data visualization skills and can build slide presentations that will be read by multiple C-level executives. You are an outstanding teammate and a highly accountable customer advocate with high integrity. You flourish in ambiguity because you know how to provide clarity through structured thinking and fact-based analysis.**This is an individual contributor role**At least 18 years of ageLegally authorized to work in the United StatesHigh School Diploma or GEDPre-employment background screenBachelor’s degree; MBA or Masters in a Quantitative or Business field preferred10+ years’ experience in Management Consulting, Strategy, Planning or Analysis5+ years’ Digital experience, in Ecommerce or Omni-Channel5+ years’ experience with Analytics, Management Systems, and MeasurementAdvanced analytical and quantitative skills, particularly Investment Banking level modeling; strong bias towards data-based decision making. Expertise in Excel, SQL and other similar tools. Strong visualization skills are required as is the ability to put together a strong data narrativeStrong written and verbal communication skillsCan articulate visions/strategies/ideas/proposals clearly and conciselyProven understanding of high-performing organizationsShown ability to work across organizational departments and develop positive relationships across a companyAbility to measure, evaluate and act on financial and operational results#LI-CK1Thoroughly internalize the business and stay fully connected with the strategies and prioritiesTake a lead role in building out the Digital Value Realization Office and system, which will support T-Mobile’s 5-year strategic plan.Develop tools and processes to drive business case analysis at scaleDrive the creation of, access to, and adoption of tools, dashboards, and reports that provide critical business data to Digital product teams. Work with disparate data source owners to deliver data and metrics in a format that can be easily manipulated and consumed by end users.Work with sophisticated data structures, manipulate, cleanse data and perform analysisPerform advanced analytics, including modeling, forecasting, predictive analytics that deliver recommendations for growth, cost reduction and optimization of operational performance.Act as lead analytics consultant for solving business questions, building business cases, opportunity analysis, and critical metric developmentBuild and deliver presentations for a C-level audienceCollaborate with a team of other Business Analysis Managers on core business problems while providing mentorship to junior members of the team.Equal Employment OpportunityWe take equal opportunity seriously—by choice.T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

The Sr. Business Analyst at Zonar works as part of the IT Business Applications team working to identify, define, and support delivery of processes and solutions within Zonar’s Microsoft Dynamics Business Central (ERP), Dynamics CRM, and Business Intelligence platforms. These robust systems help enable the business and internal end-user communities to manage and support our customers successfully and efficiently. In this role you work directly with business stakeholders, end-users, technology partners, and solution developers. You will help drive the identification and scoping of solutions, determine solution feasibility, support development of business/functional requirements, and work directly with ERP development and other technology resources to ensure delivery of solutions that meet agreed to specifications and requirements. This position will also play a key role in identifying and executing on our strategic roadmap as it relates to next generation business capabilities supported by technology.WHAT YOU WILL DOBe an authority and subject matter expert within your area(s) of focus.Identify both business and technical opportunities specific to area of focus (e.g., leveraging of new features, new integrations, optimized business process, etc.)Become an expert in the capabilities of current and future software solutions Zonar may employ.Collaborate with business stakeholders to define and document business requirements. management.Prepare assigned project and end-user documentation, system configuration documentation, and related technical reports.Manage engagement with third party vendors supporting your area of focus.Work cross-functionally with peers to identify opportunities across systems and/or shared workflows.Drive and/or participate in end-user training and stakeholder reviews specific to your area of focus.WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE TEAM5+ years analyzing functional capabilities of an ERP solution (e.g., Microsoft Dynamics NAV/Business Central, Oracle, SAP, NetSuite, or like solution)4+ years of Finance and/or Accounting experience, or experience with supporting Finance/Accounting in a Business Analyst roleWorking knowledge of data and process mapping and modelling methodologies3+ years of Project Management, Sr. Business Analyst, or related experience required.Experience with Binary Stream subscription billing suite preferred.Experience using MS SQL preferredExperience with data visualization tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, or like solutionsProven experience in software evaluation, selection, and implementationExperience with supporting back-office systems focused on financial/operational business functions.Strong written, interpersonal, analytical, and oral communication skillsAbility to drive definition of improvements based on business needs.Familiarity with agile development practices and methodologiesAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Ability to work toward and achieve scheduled deadlines.Ability to conduct research into issues and solutions as required including ROI analysis.Ability to present ideas and data to varied audiences at all levels of the organization.Highly self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail.Comfortable working with a skilled technical environment with rapid changes in direction and environmentStrong understanding of operational and business workflowsStrong conceptual, analytical, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and resolution skillsComprehensive knowledge of systems development lifecycle including business analysis, requirements development, cost benefit analysis, change management, process reengineering, use cases, user acceptance testing, data migration, user training and ongoing systems support.ABOUT USFounded in 2001, Zonar has pioneered smart fleet management technology by providing innovative technology that has changed fleet operations in the vocational, pupil and commercial trucking industries. With a unique focus on this field, the Company offers a complete suite of solutions and specialized platforms for our customers in multiple markets. Our patented, award-winning technology keeps fleet owners and managers connected to their fleets and drivers to dispatchers. Zonar has a proven history of continuous innovation on behalf of our customers, providing products that efficiently and easily track commercial fleets and assets, streamline reporting and significantly increasing safety while saving cost. Leveraging a portfolio of 150+ patents, we are building upon these data and related analytics services to create the next generation of software and services for the 15M target customers in the US alone.Headquartered in Seattle and wholly owned by technology company Continental, Zonar has a Technology Development Center in downtown Seattle, a regional office in Cincinnati, and a distribution center outside of Atlanta. Our culture is based on ingenuity, leadership, teamwork, excellence, passion, integrity, and fun! Our company has grown to over 450 employees who are goal-oriented and fast-paced but understand the importance of having a healthy work life balance. This is an excellent opportunity to work for a fast-paced, growing, innovative company, make a big impact on a rapidly evolving space, and have fun along the way.

UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty. All of which has allowed the UW to be nationally recognized as a “Great College to Work For” for six consecutive years.The University of Washington’s Finance Readiness Program has an outstanding opportunity for a Business Analyst to provide a key role in the planning and implementation of an enterprise-wide financial system and modernization of related business processes. The Finance Readiness Program is a collaborative partner to the broader UW Finance Transformation program. UWFT is a multi-year effort to transform the UW’s existing financial processes through business process redesign and the replacement of legacy systems with modern technology. This position will be part of the FRP collaborative business partner team responsible for ensuring that UW’s central finance division is operationally ready to execute new processes, policies and procedures with excellence post “go live”.The purpose of this position is to analyze, measure, design, depict, and present current and future state business and operational processes along with their relationship to and utilization of technology. This position is responsible for navigating the wealth of data and turning it into actionable and insightful information for the University. The Business Analyst will work directly with University Department/unit leaders, providing consultation and support in the development, analysis, interpretation and management of a variety of complex internal and external data sources as well as business process areas. The incumbent draws on expertise in data collection methodologies to support subsequent data analysis, and finance processes and statistics; prepares charts and graphs; applies appropriate statistical tests; provides analytical commentary; and educates analytical concepts in an understandable and actionable manner. The Business Analyst operates under general or minimum supervision, and performs duties with broad latitude for exercising independent judgment.Responsibilities:AnalysisInvestigate and analyze current For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.A higher degree of healthcare.All across UW Medicine, our employees collaborate to perform the highest quality work with integrity and compassion and to create a respectful, welcoming environment where every patient, family, student and colleague is valued and honored.UW Medicine’s IT Services department has an outstanding opportunity for an Business Intelligence Business Analyst 2! This position is currently 100% remote due to COVID-19. When restrictions are lifted and staff can return to the workplace, there is a high likelihood of partial ongoing remote work in the future.UW Medicine’s Information Technology Services (ITS) department is a shared services organization that supports all of UW Medicine. UW Medicine is comprised of Harborview Medical Center (HMC), UW Medical Center-Montlake Campus (UWMC-Montlake), UW Medical Center-Northwest Campus (UWMC-NW), Valley Medical Center (VMC), UW Neighborhood Clinics (UWNC), UW Physicians (UWP), UW School of Medicine (SOM) and Airlift Northwest (ALNW). In addition, UW Medicine shares in the ownership and governance of Children’s University Medical Group and Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (a partnership between UW Medicine, Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research and Seattle Children’s). ITS is responsible for the ongoing support and maintenance of the infrastructure and applications which support all of these institutions, along with the implementation of new services and applications that are used to support and further the UW Medicine mission.In collaboration with UW Medicine IT Services (‘ITS’) and under the general guidance of the Assistant Director, Analytics Consulting, the primary focuses of the Business Intelligence Business Analyst 2 (‘BI Analyst 2’) areworking with internal customers to define and prioritize business requirements;partnering with development, application, and other Analyst teams to design and implement analytics solutions; andproviding an overall excellent customer experience.While all members of the Analytics Consulting group are expected to develop proficiency across all domains we support, areas of responsibility for this role include, but are not limited to:access management process oversight and implementation for Analytics solutions;service request (ticket) management and triage;identifying and implementing internal process improvement within Analytics; andcomplex business requirements gathering and management.As a member of the Analytics Consulting group the BI Analyst 2 directly supports the triage of incoming customer requests with other team members; works broadly across the Analytics Consulting group to ensure effective work prioritization; and ensures requests are assigned to the best possible resource(s). The BI Analyst 2 engages with other team members to drive process improvement within the Analytics Consulting group and throughout the department as a whole. The incumbent stays up-to-date on all department solutions and services and frequently demonstrates and educates customers on existing and new tools.This position is expected to leverage enterprise business intelligence tools to answer questions about data, produce meaningful analyses, and independently create reports, dashboards, and other data visualizations when needed. Overall, data analytics is a strategic function within UW Medicine with a large set of growing demands. The ability to deliver improved analytics, faster, and at a lower cost is essential to both tactical and strategic success of UW Medicine overall. This role provides crucial support to UW Medicine and its partners for all of the major initiatives that require operational reporting, visualization or dashboards to deliver information to all levels of the organization and affect change. The analytics solutions developed by this role are used to support clinical, operational, and financial reporting and analysis and are key to the success of the organization as a whole. Position Summary:Bedrock's IT Manufacturing/MRP Business Analyst is responsible to review, analyze, and evaluate business processes and organizational needs. To gather and document business requirements, define scope and objectives, and identify system modifications needed to support these business requirements and initiatives. This position will follow defined departmental standards, and help define new ones as appropriate, as well as advise and transfer knowledge end users.

A successful candidate will need to interact directly with business owners and business users, as well as other functional Business Analysts, Project Managers, and Support staff.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyze, and document existing business processes and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).
Work directly with internal customers to identify and develop new business processes, process improvements, and system modifications.
Identify and gather business requirements, using use cases, data modeling, process modeling, context diagrams, systems diagrams, etc.
Develop functional specifications for system modifications.
Develop Test Cases and Test Plans.
Responsible to test system changes within specified functional areas, and regression testing.
Modify existing Dynamics AX configurations to meet business needs.
Maintain an expertise within the appropriate Dynamics AX functional area and configuration.
Provide end-user support for Dynamics AX, using current internal support processes and tools.
Create and manage support tickets and coordinate support activities as needed.
Provide end user training.

Skills and Qualifications:



Two-year college degree required or applicable trade school, or equivalent working experience.
Four-year college degree preferred.
3+ years Dynamics AX for Manufacturing and MRP experience.
3+ years experience working with core manufacturing business processes (Shop Floor Controls, Material and Resource Planning/Scheduling, Production Routing, Bill of Material Costing, and Warehouse Management)
3+ years experience in business system analysis and business process improvement.
Experience writing functional requirements specification for Dynamics AX 2012.
Experience with Dynamics AX 2012 implementations and configurations.
Excellent communication, both verbal and written.
Strong requirements gathering skills (interviewing business owners and operational users).
Excellent project management and organizational skills.

About us

We are a technology solution development and management consulting practice. Our focus is on real-world problems and real-world solutions. We build engaging custom software, integrate commercial solutions, and automate IT. The key to our success is our people; people who value clear communication, pragmatism, and commitment to deliver complete solutions.

We build for scale and accelerate development through cloud services and platforms. We also help guide technology program transformations, helping our clients to establish leading practices like the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFeⓇ).

Our consultants come from all backgrounds, ranging from the self-taught to academics with advanced degrees. One thing all of our consultants have in common is a desire to learn and collaborate with their team. We encourage and invest in the growth of our employees. We need you to help us grow; let us help you grow too!

About the job

We are looking for an experienced Business Systems Analyst to join one of our engagement teams. This analyst will focus on Amazon purchasing processes and helping vendors in the Amazon marketplace.

This role will work directly with our client’s executive leadership team and our Design Practice lead. You will support the ideation process with this team, and in turn define the resulting new business workflows (or workflows that need to change) with the development team.

Experience practicing Lean and Agile principles, or experience on a development team that practices continuous delivery is a major plus! You will write these requirements as Epics, Features, and User Stories in a shared team backlog and support the developers as they decompose the User Stories into tasks.

Things you have done, or know


Previous experience on a Technology Solution delivery team.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Strong analytical skills; a “problem solver”
Enjoys ‘forensic’ systems analysis, understanding existing software, user workflows
Experience working with Azure DevOps, JIRA, or other Agile development team tools.
Familiarity with Scrum
Familiarity with Kanban
Understanding of software engineering vocabulary and data architecture.

The benefits

iTrellis provides an inspiring environment to improve your career and thrive. Our strong benefits package includes the following:


A very low deductible Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance of which the company will pay 100% of the premiums for you, and 50% for any eligible dependents. For those that elect to pursue healthcare coverage elsewhere we offer a monthly stipend to help offset your costs.

We presently support your contributions to a 401(k) Plan with 100% Company matching for the first 3% of your contributions, and match an additional 50% for any elections you make up to 5% of your annualized salary; All Company Contributions vest immediately

We offer flexible scheduling arrangements and 120 hours of Paid Time Off, in addition to 8 Paid Holidays.

Training and education resources relevant to your discipline will be made available to help guide the Unique Career Development opportunities available to you. This includes licenses to Pluralsight and a stipend going towards continuous education, conferences, and meetups.

iTrellis is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicants or employees on the base of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetics or any other legally protected class. **At this time, we do NOT offer Visa sponsorship**

Remitly is on a mission to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial products on the planet. For nearly 10 years, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to immigrants sending their hard earned money home. Today, we are incredibly proud to have served millions of customers globally with Remitly and our newly launched banking product, Passbook. We strive daily to meet our promise to our customers by building peace of mind into everything we do. Join over 1,300 employees across 9 offices who are growing their careers while having a positive impact on people globally.

The Team:

The Passbook team is a startup within Remitly, and we think combines the best parts of working in a startup with the best parts of working in a later stage technology company.

Passbook is banking designed for immigrants. It's easy to open an account with documents immigrants already have, built for travel back home and abroad, has no monthly fees, and makes remittances faster and cheaper than ever. Our mission is to create the most loved and trusted banking partner to immigrants globally. And we're just getting started.

The Role:

As a Business Analyst on the Passbook team, you help plan our financial future and inform our strategy. You're at the intersection of the customer-facing business and finance. Reporting to the Director of Marketing Analytics for Passbook, you will analyze customer behavior and financial data to build forecast models and own our management P&L reporting. You'll identify levers for profit margin growth, forecast new customer growth, new business opportunities, and challenge the team on how we grow to serve our customers.

What You'll Do:

Dive deep into our invoices, contracts, and partner systems to become the subject matter expert on our revenue and cost of sales modelBuild our business management view of our P&L with a vision for how our business economics scale at a unit, customer, and business levelImprove our LTV modeling and use of the model to inform our strategic roadmapHelp guide the strategic planning processIdentify customer behavior insights that lead to growth or efficiency recommendationsConduct marketing sizing to inform financial models

Who You Are:

You are a builder - and no problem space is too small, no vision is too big.You ask "Why?" and are willing to challenge ideasExperience with and understanding of financial management and basic accounting concepts (P&L line items, variable vs fixed costs)Bachelor's degree in a technical, business, or quantitative field (Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Finance, Statistics, or related field)2+ years of experience in Business Analysis, preferably within B2C"Craft" skills with SQL and spreadsheet modelingExperience with data visualization and related tools (e.g., Tableau, Periscope)

Our Benefits

Unlimited paid time offHealth, dental, and vision benefits and 401k plan with company matchingCompany contributions to your HSA or FSA plan, if you choose oneContinuing education and corridor travel benefitsScholars program

We are searching for a Sr. Business Systems Analyst to join our Business Application team at Glassdoor. Our team delivers the capability that fuels the growth and efficiency at Glassdoor.

This position is an individual contributor role and will collaborate closely with and report to the Manager, Business Applications. We welcome remote hiring, with our main office locations in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL and Uniontown, OH.

We're looking for someone that will further cultivate and nurture a deep partnership and highly productive consultative relationship with Glassdoor's internal business partners. You will be responsible for understanding the Glassdoor business and its operations, excelling at translating business needs from Finance, Sales Operations, and Product business teams into robust & scalable technical solutions.

This position will additionally work on a portfolio of exciting Business Application projects & services, with a focus on Glassdoor's global Finance, Accounting, and FP&A functions, providing structure & leadership to process optimization projects as well as deep expertise in developing new or improving existing workflows.

Expect to be integral in supporting key business processes across Glassdoor and to be charged with analyzing and implementing best practices / standard methodologies across key financial systems including NetSuite and Salesforce, inclusive of automating repetitive, low-value manual work.Responsibilities include:

Maintaining the relationship between Finance and IT to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.
Functioning as a FinTech Product Manager and partner to model, design, and build business solutions that improve Glassdoor's Finance processes.
Working closely with multi-functional partners including Finance, Sales Operations, Product & Engineering, leading the charge with projects from inception through delivery, including taking point on providing status updates, balancing budgets, and efficiently & effectively navigating scope changes.
Responding to issues & incidents, providing day-to-day administration and support of NetSuite, Coupa, Zuora, and RevPro and ideally Salesforce.com.
Actively monitoring systems and integrations for issues, finding opportunities for improvement in processes, data, or systematic solutions.
Partnering with business leadership, both internal & external development resources, as well as suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutions.
Collaborating with offshore application development teams to develop new solutions and run User Acceptance Testing with your business groups
Developing and maintaining documentation on both current and new system processes and flows.

Basic Qualifications:



Hands-on experience with NetSuite ERP is required.
Bachelor's degree in the field of computer science or information systems.
2+ years of experience with NetSuite required
5+ experience in IT analysis, design and development of complex ERP solutions.
5+ years of technical experience and project management in a fast-growing, technology organization, preferably cloud-based (SaaS) product delivery.
Deep understanding of key financial business processes (Quote-to-Cash, Billing, Collections, Revenue Management, Procure-to-Pay).
Exceptional problem solving and analytical/critical thinking skills needed, as well as outstanding interpersonal skills.
Effective communication with exceptional active listening skills, with a proven record of successfully conveying complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to both technical and non-technical audiences alike.
You will obsess - in a good way! - over performance, user experience, and efficiency.
Administrator level knowledge and experience of roles, permissions, custom objects, scripting, workflows, reports, and dashboards
Work directly with internal/external developers, NetSuite and/or other Professional Services organization to properly configure modules and integrations
Actively identify issues and propose solutions to solve business needs through new configurations, workflows, or customizations

Preferred Qualifications:



We'd love to see an in-depth understanding of Netsuite's capabilities and constraints.
Experience with Salesforce, Boomi, or RevPro is a plus!
SaaS business model experience in a hyper-growth environment strongly preferred.
NetSuite Administrator Certification.
Netsuite ERP Certification.

Why Glassdoor?

Work with purpose join us in creating transparency for job seekers everywhere
100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage
Long Term Incentive Plan
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off

Our Commitments

A values-based culture: Our values are Transparency, Innovation, Good People and Grit. We look for talented, passionate people who embody these values in how they show up to work every day.
Pay transparency: We believe that with more salary transparency, you hold the information to ensure fair pay now and in the future as your career changes and grows. Pay bands and our compensation philosophy are shared publicly to ensure that everyone is paid fairly. Our annual Pay Gap Study found no gender or race/ethnicity pay gap at Glassdoor.
Diversity & Inclusion transparency: We are committed to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our commitment. We also provide programs and resources to create a greater sense of belonging for our employees.
Employee feedback transparency: We believe in providing you with greater insight into what it is really like to work with us. In addition to our Glassdoor Reviews, we publicly publish our employee feedback survey responses to ensure everyone has a complete picture of what it's like to work here.
Company performance transparency: We believe you should know how your work contributes to moving the company forward. That's why we share detailed business performance updates in our monthly All Hands and deeper financial results every quarter. For more insight into the performance of our parent company, you can explore the financial results of Recruit Holdings, and its HR Technology segment in particular, each quarter. Operating transparently at Glassdoor is fundamental as we advocate for transparency in the broader workforce. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!
