UWFT will fundamentally change the processes and tools that the University employs to track, spend, collect, manage, and report University finances in excess of $7B in annual revenues, resulting in more timely and actionable information for leadership.The ACCOUNTING BUSINESS ANALYST - (BA) will work in partnership with the Design PM and Accounting/Finance subject matter experts to evaluate source GL accounts for translation to the new Workday Foundation Data Model (FDM) and assist in development of the new Workday data model.The Workday FDM includes chart of account elements and additional financial dimensions. The BA will assist in reconciliation between multiple legacy and future state general ledgers. The BA will be a key project team member and is responsible to facilitate meetings, document requirements and user stories, support testing program, and help to identify and manage issues and risks.The successful candidate will support UW Medicine Accounting operations to support the UWFT initiative with minimal disruption to the service or quality by supporting business process redevelopment. The resource will provide guidance and support to operational subject matter experts as part of this large program. This includes but is not limited to supporting business process design, issue / risk communication and scalation, supporting development of recommended solutions, and collaborating on analytic tasks and execution.The UW has an existing Workday platform, utilizing the HCM/Payroll/Benefits modules. This includes a backend infrastructure around security, access, and report development. The UWFT program will be responsible for implementing new financial modules that need to be integrated into the existing platform and will also need to include significant new functionality for finance. The new modules are scheduled to go live on July 1, 2022.DUTIES:DATA ANALYSIS Work with data owners to collect, organize, and analyze multiple legacy systems’ chart of account elements, statistical accounts, and other related accounting values Develop and maintain cross walk documentation for chart of account elements Maintain the integrity of the project data over the life of the projectFACILITATION AND CONSULTATION Assist in the development of data analysis summaries and visualizations in support of a wide range of working sessions Facilitate working sessions with a wide range of stakeholders, subject matter experts, and project staffTESTING Support team members to develop and execute test scripts Provide FDM and crosswalk data subject matter expertise to technical teams as needed Capture and document requirements and user stories Assist the project team to identify and manage issues and risks through their lifecycle Other duties as assignedREQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree in Business or related degree4 to 5 years experience: Minimum of four years of experience performing complex work in business analysis Experience designing, developing, optimizing, or analyzing chart of accounts Experience implementing new tools and processes with Accounting and Finance teams Experience working with a wide range of data collection, analysis, and visualization tools Demonstrated collaboration skills with colleagues at all levels and across different organizations Demonstrated ability to work independently and with minimal supervision Experience facilitating meetings, constructively addressing input and criticism, and resolving conflicts Ability to present complex technical material to non-technical audiences in an approachable way Able to understand and communicate business relevance to management / leadership teams Equivalent education and experience may be substituted for requirementsDESIRED : Experience working in a healthcare or academic medical center environment Experience working on technology projects supporting business needs through analysis and support. Business Systems Analyst

Seattle, WA & San Francisco, CA (REMOTE, until otherwise noted)

About the Role. . .

Our Digital Transformation team is looking for seasoned Business Systems Analysts to work with cutting-edge technologies and interesting companies in a fast-paced, exciting environment. These Business Systems Analysts will participate in projects supporting one or more work streams and multiple business teams. You will need to have effective communication and a wide variety of skills to support or lead activities, including gathering, analyzing, and documenting stakeholder requirements (developing Process Maps/ Wire Frames/ Feature Acceptance Criteria/ User Stories), and collaborating closely with technical teams to ensure delivered solutions meet business needs.

At the same time, you’ll be joining a five-time “Best Company to Work For,” where intelligent, talented people come together to do outstanding work—and have a lot of fun while they’re at it. Because we’re a full-service consulting firm with a diverse client base, you can count on a steady stream of opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies on projects that make a real difference. Logic20/20's Global Delivery Model creates a connected experience for Logicians across geographies. You'll have access to projects in different locations, the technology to support Connected Teams, and in-person and online culture in our Connected Hub cities.

The Logic20/20 Digital Transformation team is where innovation comes to life. We apply design thinking and next-gen technologies to solve our clients’ toughest business challenges in ways they never dreamed possible. You’ll work side-by-side with various architecture, manager, and engineering consultants to gain a 360-degree perspective of the challenge at hand, while contributing your unique perspective to develop innovative solutions. And when you want to expand your horizons, we’ve got you covered. You’ll have opportunities to shape the next chapter of your career by getting hands-on experience with emerging technologies like RPA, virtual assistants, and more.

You Have. . .

Relevant work experience in evaluating business systems, project execution, or technology – empowering business through robust technology improvements. Experience managing ambiguity and complexity in unstructured operating environments, while able to navigate in larger, more structured environments. Experience with and ability to quickly develop and in-depth understanding of business rules and processes to the extent of being able to optimize/streamline the workflows. Ability to clearly communicate sophisticated concepts to the clients and project team. Experience in one or more SDLC methodology (i.e. Waterfall, Agile, Scrum), and ability to work within the process. Proficiency with Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and experience with Visio

Qualifications. . .

Have worked for a Big 4/8 management consulting firmAn undergraduate degree (BA/BS) in business or technology SDLC methodologies3-5+ years in BSA type roles (not exclusively or predominantly testing) A high degree of creativity and innovation, with proven examples of applying knowledge, experience, and judgment to ambiguous problems. Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills; must be very comfortable with data Strong consensus-building skills between business and technology partners Detail-oriented and believe that details matter greatly to the success of the solution Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills The aptitude to see and think through complex end-to-end enterprise processes and system flows

About Logic20/20. . .

Logic20/20 is one of Seattle’s fastest-growing consulting firms. We hire remarkable people to create simple, efficient solutions for complex problems.

Although we make it look like magic, our success is due to our approach (methodical and structured) and the people we hire (smart, motivated, and team oriented). Together, these enable us to consistently exceed client expectations—and our reputation is growing.

For the past five years, we’ve placed in the top ten of Seattle Business magazine’s “Best Companies to Work For”. From engaged leadership and wide-ranging benefits to career mentorship and diverse internal opportunities, we pride ourselves on being one of the best companies to work with and work for.

We hire people that are self-motivated, comfortable conceiving strategies on the fly, and enjoy working individually and as part of a team. Our work is high-energy and demanding, but new hires will quickly feel at home among colleagues as friendly and focused as they are. We bring our best to every opportunity, driving change in industries across the West Coast. Join us and you can, too.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategoryCustomer Success GroupJob DetailsWhat you’ll be doing…The Customer Success Principle Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the analytics needs for programs to drive customer retention in our Customer Success and Renewals business. This role will play a critical role in developing a framework for scalable reporting, partner with Program Managers and leadership to build ROI (Return on investment) models to support strategic investments and establish a framework to measure impact of programs. You will develop data assets and dashboards that represent the official view of our business. Based in Seattle, you will have a unique focus on the needs of our AMER (North and South American) customers, while closely aligning coordinating efforts with the business analysts based in our APJ and EMEA theaters. You will be a team lead on a small team of in-theater analysts, with an eye towards a future management position. In addition, you will provide ongoing support to better understand performance drivers on customer retention and identify areas of opportunity. As a Senior Business Analyst, you will conduct in‐depth performance analysis, provide data artifacts, and the packaging of findings/recommendations into presentation‐ready content for leadership. You will be closely aligned with the Customer Solutions Analytics and Insights team to leverage best practices and methodologies.Some of the things you’ll be doing include…Create informative and actionable insights that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement.Collect, analyze, evaluate, and report data to performance and metrics.Server as team lead for the business analysts, leading 3-4 other analysts on best practices and global alignment and coordination.Develop and maintain standardized operational reports and dashboards to monitor overall region/customer health, data integrity, and other key objectives and performance indicators.Build processes and reporting packages to empower Program Managers and leaders on most impactful programs and identify areas of opportunity.Collaborate cross departmentally to improve or define processes that promote data integrity and reporting functionality.Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.Support day‐to‐day inquiries from the team, providing prompt and efficient resolution to a wide range of issues and developing operational procedures.Collaborate cross‐functionally within the Customer Solutions Analytics and Insights organization to ensure consistent reporting standards and processes.Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues.Who you are ...Experience. 7+ years of experience as a data analyst in consulting, finance, sales operations, or product management. Excellent organizational skills and must be able to work independently with limited guidance.Team Player. Ability to work independently and with others.Data Rock Star.
